member.name: T:Aspose.Words.License
member.summary: Provides methods to license the component.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.License.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of this class.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.License.SetLicense(System.String)
member.summary: Licenses the component.

remarks.p: Tries to find the license in the following locations:
1. Explicit path.
2. The folder that contains the Aspose component assembly.
3. The folder that contains the client's calling assembly.
4. The folder that contains the entry (startup) assembly.
5. An embedded resource in the client's calling assembly.
Note:On the .NET Compact Framework, tries to find the license only in these locations:
1. Explicit path.
2. An embedded resource in the client's calling assembly.

member.param: Can be a full or short file name or name of an embedded resource. Use an empty string to switch to evaluation mode.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.License.SetLicense(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Licenses the component.
member.param: A stream that contains the license.

remarks.p: Use this method to load a license from a stream.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.License.IsLicensed
member.summary: Returns true if a valid license has been applied; false if the component is running in evaluation mode.

member.summary: Returns a at the specified index.

remarks.p: The index is zero-based.
Negative indexes are allowed and indicate access from the back of the collection. For example -1 means the last item, -2 means the second before last and so on.
If index is greater than or equal to the number of items in the list, this returns a null reference.
If index is negative and its absolute value is greater than the number of items in the list, this returns a null reference.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Fields.Field
member.summary: Represents a Microsoft Word document field.

remarks.para: A field in a Word document is a complex structure consisting of multiple nodes that include field start, field code, field separator, field result and field end. Fields can be nested, contain rich content and span multiple paragraphs or sections in a document. The class is a "facade" object that provides properties and methods that allow to work with a field as a single object.
The , and properties point to the field start, separator and end nodes of the field respectively.

The content between the field start and separator is the field code. The content between the field separator and field end is the field result. The field code typically consists of one or more objects that specify instructions. The processing application is expected to execute the field code to calculate the field result.

The process of calculating field results is called the field update. Aspose.Words can update field results of most of the field types in exactly the same way as Microsoft Word does it. Most notably, Aspose.Words can calculate results of even the most complex formula fields. To calculate the field result of a single field use the method. To update fields in the whole document use .

You can get the plain text version of the field code using the method. You can get and set the plain text version of the field result using the property. Both the field code and field result can contain complex content, such as nested fields, paragraphs, shapes, tables and in this case you might want to work with the field nodes directly if you need more control.
You do not create instances of the class directly. To create a new field use the method.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Fields.Field.GetFieldCode
member.summary: Returns text between field start and field separator (or field end if there is no separator).

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.CompositeNode
member.summary: Base class for nodes that can contain other nodes.

remarks.p: A document is represented as a tree of nodes, similar to DOM or XmlDocument.
For more info see the Composite design pattern.
The class:

list.item: Provides access to the child nodes.
Implements Composite operations such as insert and remove children.
Provides methods for XPath navigation.

member.dev:
Maintains a pointer to the list of children.
Provides helper methods to insert or remove a whole range of nodes.
Inserting and removing children are the most important features here.
Public API methods for insert and remove verify the arguments well and raise the insert/delete node events to the owner document.
The child nodes are stored in a circular doubly linked list and the composite node knows only its last child. This approach was taken from XmlElement (with addition of doubly linking). Inserting or removing a node just means updating the PrevSibling, NextSibling and ParentNode of the appropriate nodes.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Node
member.summary: Base class for all nodes of a Word document.

remarks.p: A document is represented as a tree of nodes, similar to DOM or XmlDocument.
For more info see the Composite design pattern.
The class:

list.item: Defines the child node interface.
Defines the interface for visiting nodes.
Provides default cloning capability.
Implements parent node and owner document mechanisms.
Implements access to sibling nodes.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Node.Clone(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a duplicate of the node.

remarks.p: This method serves as a copy constructor for nodes. The cloned node has no parent, but belongs to the same document as the original node.
This method always performs a deep copy of the node. The isCloneChildren parameter specifies whether to perform copy all child nodes as well.

member.param: True to recursively clone the subtree under the specified node; false to clone only the node itself.
member.returns: The cloned node.
member.dev: You should use the overload when the node cloning is a part of another (usually composite) node cloning process. And you should pass down the parameter in this case.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Node.Accept(Aspose.Words.DocumentVisitor)
member.summary: Accepts a visitor.

remarks.p: Enumerates over this node and all of its children. Each node calls a corresponding method on DocumentVisitor.
For more info see the Visitor design pattern.

member.param: The visitor that will visit the nodes.
member.returns: True if all nodes were visited; false if DocumentVisitor stopped the operation before visiting all nodes.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Node.GetText
member.summary: Gets the text of this node and of all its children.

remarks.p: The returned string includes all control and special characters as described in .

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Node.GetAncestor(System.Type)
member.summary: Gets the first ancestor of the specified object type.
member.param: The object type of the ancestor to retrieve.
member.returns: The ancestor of the specified type or null if no ancestor of this type was found.

remarks.p: The ancestor type matches if it is equal to ancestorType or derived from ancestorType.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Node.GetAncestor(Aspose.Words.NodeType)
member.summary: Gets the first ancestor of the specified .
member.param: The node type of the ancestor to retrieve.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Node.ToTxt
member.summary: Exports the content of the node into a string in plain text format.

remarks.p: This method removes field codes and Microsoft Word control characters, uses CrLf (or any other) combination of characters to mark ends of paragraphs in the resulting string. It produces a different result from which just gets the text from the node without removing field codes or special characters.

member.returns: The content of the node in plain text format.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.CompositeNode.GetChildNodes(Aspose.Words.NodeType,System.Boolean)
member.overloads: Returns a collection of child nodes that match the specified type.
member.summary: Returns a live collection of child nodes that match the specified type.

remarks.p: The collection of nodes returned by this method is always live.

A live collection is always in sync with the document. For example, if you selected all sections in a document and enumerate through the collection deleting the sections, the section is removed from the collection immediately when it is removed from the document.

member.param: Specifies the type of nodes to select.
True to select from all child nodes recursively. False to select only among immediate children.
member.returns: A live collection of child nodes of the specified type.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.CompositeNode.GetChildNodes(Aspose.Words.NodeType,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns a collection of child nodes that match the specified type.

remarks.p: This method is obsolete. is not used anymore. Please use instead.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.CompositeNode.GetChild(Aspose.Words.NodeType,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns an Nth child node that matches the specified type.

remarks.p: If index is out of range, a null is returned.

member.param: Specifies the type of the child node.
Zero based index of the child node to select. Negative indexes are also allowed and indicate access from the end, that is -1 means the last node.
True to select from all child nodes recursively. False to select only among immediate children.
member.returns: The child node that matches the criteria or null if no matching node is found.

member.returns: A list of nodes matching the XPath query.

member.param: The XPath expression.

member.summary: Provides support for the for each style iteration over the child nodes of this node.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.CompositeNode.AppendChild(Aspose.Words.Node)
member.summary: Adds the specified node to the end of the list of child nodes for this node.

remarks.p: If the newChild is already in the tree, it is first removed.
If the node being inserted was created from another document, you should use to import the node to the current document. The imported node can then be inserted into the current document.

member.param: The node to add.
member.returns: The node added.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.CompositeNode.PrependChild(Aspose.Words.Node)
member.summary: Adds the specified node to the beginning of the list of child nodes for this node.

remarks.p: If the newChild is already in the tree, it is first removed.
If the node being inserted was created from another document, you should use to import the node to the current document. The imported node can then be inserted into the current document.

member.param: The node to add.
member.returns: The node added.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.CompositeNode.InsertAfter(Aspose.Words.Node,Aspose.Words.Node)
member.summary: Inserts the specified node immediately after the specified reference node.

remarks.p: If refChild is null, inserts newChild at the beginning of the list of child nodes.
If the newChild is already in the tree, it is first removed.
If the node being inserted was created from another document, you should use to import the node to the current document. The imported node can then be inserted into the current document.

member.param: The Node to insert.
The Node that is the reference node. The newNode is placed after the refNode.
member.returns: The inserted node.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.CompositeNode.InsertBefore(Aspose.Words.Node,Aspose.Words.Node)
member.summary: Inserts the specified node immediately before the specified reference node.

remarks.p: If refChild is null, inserts newChild at the end of the list of child nodes.
If the newChild is already in the tree, it is first removed.
If the node being inserted was created from another document, you should use to import the node to the current document. The imported node can then be inserted into the current document.

member.param: The Node to insert.
The Node that is the reference node. The newChild is placed before this node.
member.returns: The inserted node.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.CompositeNode.RemoveChild(Aspose.Words.Node)
member.summary: Removes the specified child node.

remarks.p: The parent of oldChild is set to null after the node is removed.

member.param: The node to remove.
member.returns: The removed node.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.CompositeNode.RemoveAllChildren
member.summary: Removes all the child nodes of the current node.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.CompositeNode.RemoveSmartTags
member.summary: Removes all descendant nodes of the current node.
member.remarks: This method does not remove the content of the smart tags.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.CompositeNode.InsertBefore(Aspose.Words.Node,Aspose.Words.Node,Aspose.Words.Node)
member.summary: Inserts nodes starting from the start node up to, but not including the end node into this node before the reference node.
member.param: Node to start moving from.
Can be null to indicate move all from start to the end.
The nodes will be inserted before this node.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.CompositeNode.InsertAfter(Aspose.Words.Node,Aspose.Words.Node,Aspose.Words.Node)
member.summary: Inserts nodes starting from the start node up to, but not including the end node into this node after the reference node.
member.param: Node to start moving from.
Can be null to indicate move all from start to the end.
The nodes will be inserted after this node.

member.summary: Returns the index of the specified child node in the child node array.
member.remarks: Returns -1 if the node is not found in the child nodes.

summary.p: This namespace contains classes of the Aspose.Words' new reporting engine that supports report templates marked up with a language based on the LINQ Method Syntax.

This new reporting engine is more advanced than the original mail merge reporting engine and allows to retrieve data from any .NET class, perform grouping, sorting, joining and interpret C# expressions.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Reporting.ReportingEngine
member.summary: Provides routines to populate template documents with data and a set of settings to control these routines.
member.dev: This class is just a facade of . Descriptional comments of these classes should be kept in sync.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Reporting.ReportingEngine.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of this class.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Reporting.ReportingEngine.BuildReport(Aspose.Words.Document,System.Object)
member.summary: Populates the specified template document with data from the specified source making it a ready report.
member.remarks: Using this overload you can reference the data source's members in the template document, but you can not reference the data source object itself. You should use the overload to achieve this.
member.param: A template document to be populated with data.
A data source object.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Reporting.ReportingEngine.BuildReport(Aspose.Words.Document,System.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Populates the specified template document with data from the specified source making it a ready report.
member.remarks: Using this overload you can reference the data source's members and the data source object itself in the template. If you are not going to reference the data source object itself, you can omit passing null or use the overload.
member.param: A template document to be populated with data.
A data source object.
A name to reference the data source object in the template.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Reporting.ReportingEngine.KnownTypes
member.summary: Gets an unordered set (i.e. a collection of unique items) containing objects which fully or partially qualified names can be used within report templates processed by this engine instance to invoke the corresponding types' static members, perform type casts, etc.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Reporting.ReportingEngine.UseReflectionOptimization
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether invocations of custom type members performed via reflection API are optimized using dynamic class generation or not. The default value is true.
member.remarks: There are some scenarios where it is preferrable to disable this optimization. For example, if you are dealing with small collections of data items all the time, then an overhead of dynamic class generation can be more noticeable than an overhead of direct reflection API calls.
member.dev: Normally, such settings should be located in configuration files, but it seems like there is no autoportable way to achieve this.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.DocumentVisitor
member.summary: Base class for custom document visitors.

remarks.p: With DocumentVisitor you can define and execute custom operations that require enumeration over the document tree.
For example, Aspose.Words uses DocumentVisitor internally for saving Document in various formats and for other operations like finding fields or bookmarks over a fragment of a document.
To use DocumentVisitor:

list.item: Create a class derived from DocumentVisitor.
Override and provide implementations for some or all of the VisitXXX methods to perform some custom operations.
Call Node.Accept on the Node that you want to start the enumeration from.

remarks.p: DocumentVisitor provides default implementations for all of the VisitXXX methods to make it easier to create new document visitors as only the methods required for the particular visitor need to be overridden. It is not necessary to override all of the visitor methods.
For more information see the Visitor design pattern.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.DocumentVisitor.VisitFieldStart(Aspose.Words.Fields.FieldStart)
member.summary: Called when a field starts in the document.

remarks.p: A field in a Word Word document consists of a field code and field value.
For example, a field that displays a page number can be represented as follows:
[FieldStart]PAGE[FieldSeparator]98[FieldEnd]
The field separator separates field code from field value in the document. Note that some fields have only field code and do not have field separator and field value.
Fields can be nested.

member.param: The object that is being visited.
member.returns: A value that specifies how to continue the enumeration.

member.summary: Called when a field separator is encountered in the document.

member.returns: A value that specifies how to continue the enumeration.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.IHyphenationCallback
member.summary: Implemented by classes which can register hyphenation dictionaries. Use this mehod

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.IHyphenationCallback.RequestDictionary(System.String)
member.summary:
Notifies application that hyphenation dictionary for the specified language wasn't found and may need to be registered.
Implementation should find a dictionary and register it using methods.
If dictionary is unavailable for the specified language implementation can opt out of further calls for the same language using with null value.
member.param: A language name, e.g. "en-US". See .NET documentation for "culture name" and RFC 4646 for details.
member.remarks: Exceptions thrown by this method will abort execution of page layout process.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Hyphenation
member.summary: Provides methods for working with hyphenation dictionaries. These dictionaries prescribe where words of a specific language can be hyphenated.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Hyphenation.RegisterDictionary(System.String,System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Registers and loads a hyphenation dictionary for the specified language from a stream. Throws if dictionary cannot be read or has invalid format.
member.param: A language name, e.g. "en-US". See .NET documentation for "culture name" and RFC 4646 for details.
A stream for the dictionary file in OpenOffice format.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Hyphenation.RegisterDictionary(System.String,System.String)
member.summary:
Registers and loads a hyphenation dictionary for the specified language from file. Throws if dictionary cannot be read or has invalid format.
This method can also be used to register Null dictionary to prevent from being called repeatedly for the same language.
member.param: A language name, e.g. "en-US". See .NET documentation for "culture name" and RFC 4646 for details.

A path to the dictionary file in Open Office format.
If this parameter is null or empty string then registered is Null dictionary and callback is not called anymore for this language.
To enable callback again use method.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Hyphenation.UnregisterDictionary(System.String)
member.summary:
Unregisters a hyphenation dictionary for the specified language.
This is different from registering Null dictionary. Unregistering a dictionary enables callback for the specified language.
member.param:
A language name, e.g. "en-US". See .NET documentation for "culture name" and RFC 4646 for details.
If null or empty string then all dictionaries are unregistered.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Hyphenation.IsDictionaryRegistered(System.String)
member.summary: Returns False if for the specified language there is no dictionary registered or if registered is Null dictionary, True otherwise.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Hyphenation.Callback
member.summary: Gets or sets callback interface used to request dictionaries when page layout of the document is built. This allows delay loading of dictionaries which may be usefull when processing documents in many languages.

summary.para: This class allows to compute page numbers of document nodes.

remarks.para: When you create a and specify a document object to attach to, the collector will record mapping of document nodes to layout objects when the document is formatted into pages.

You will be able to find out on which page a particular document node (e.g. run, paragraph or table cell) is located by using the , and methods. These methods automatically build page layout model of the document and update fields if required.
When you no longer need to collect layout information, it is best to set the property to null to avoid unnecessary collection of more layout mappings.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Layout.LayoutCollector.#ctor(Aspose.Words.Document)
member.summary: Initializes an instance of this class.
member.param: The document to which this collector instance will be attached to.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Layout.LayoutCollector.GetStartPageIndex(Aspose.Words.Node)
member.summary: Gets 1-based index of the page where node begins. Returns 0 if node cannot be mapped to a page.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Layout.LayoutCollector.GetEndPageIndex(Aspose.Words.Node)
member.summary: Gets 1-based index of the page where node ends. Returns 0 if node cannot be mapped to a page.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Layout.LayoutCollector.GetNumPagesSpanned(Aspose.Words.Node)
member.summary: Gets number of pages the specified node spans. 0 if node is within a single page. This is the same as - .

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Layout.LayoutCollector.Clear
member.summary: Clears all collected layout data. Call this method after document was manually updated, or layout was rebuilt.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Layout.LayoutCollector.GetEntity(Aspose.Words.Node)
member.summary: Returns an opaque position of the which corresponds to the specified node. You can use returned value as an argument to given the document being enumerated and the document of the node are the same.

remarks.para: This method works for only nodes, as well as indivisible inline nodes, e.g. or . It doesn't work for , or nodes, and nodes within header/footer.
Note that the entity returned for a node is a paragraph break span. Use the appropriate method to ascend to the parent line
If you need to navigate to a of text then you can insert bookmark right before it and then navigate to the bookmark instead.
If you need to navigate to a node then you can move to a node in this cell and then ascend to a parent entity. The same approach can be used for and nodes.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Layout.LayoutCollector.Document
member.summary: Gets or sets the document this collector instance is attached to.
member.remarks: If you need to access page indexes of the document nodes you need to set this property to point to a document instance, before page layout of the document is built. It is best to set this property to null afterwards, otherwise the collector continues to accumulate information from subsequent rebuilds of the document's page layout.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Layout.LayoutEnumerator
member.summary:
Enumerates page layout entities of a document.
You can use this class to walk over the page layout model. Available properties are type, geometry, text and page index where entity is rendered, as well as overall structure and relationships. Use combination of and move to the entity which corresponds to a document node.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Layout.LayoutEnumerator.#ctor(Aspose.Words.Document)
member.summary: Initializes new instance of this class.
member.param: A document whose page layout model to enumerate.

remarks.para: If page layout model of the document hasn't been built the enumerator calls to build it.
Whenever document is updated and new page layout model is created, a new enumerator must be used to access it.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Layout.LayoutEnumerator.Reset
member.summary: Moves the enumerator to the first page of the document.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Layout.LayoutEnumerator.MoveNext
member.summary:
Moves to the next sibling entity in visual order.
When iterating lines of a paragraph broken across pages this method will not move to the next page but rather move to the next entity on the same page.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Layout.LayoutEnumerator.MoveNextLogical
member.summary:
Moves to the next sibling entity in a logical order.
When iterating lines of a paragraph broken across pages this method will move to the next line even if it resides on another page.
member.remarks: Note that all entities are linked together thus if entity is span repeated calling of this method will iterates complete story of the document.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Layout.LayoutEnumerator.MovePrevious
member.summary: Moves to the previous sibling entity.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Layout.LayoutEnumerator.MovePreviousLogical
member.summary:
Moves to the previous sibling entity in a logical order.
When iterating lines of a paragraph broken across pages this method will move to the previous line even if it resides on another page.
member.remarks: Note that all entities are linked together thus if entity is span repeated calling of this method will iterates complete story of the document.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Layout.LayoutEnumerator.MoveFirstChild
member.summary: Moves to the first child entity.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Layout.LayoutEnumerator.MoveLastChild
member.summary: Moves to the last child entity.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Layout.LayoutEnumerator.MoveParent
member.summary: Moves to the parent entity.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Layout.LayoutEnumerator.MoveParent(Aspose.Words.Layout.LayoutEntityType)
member.summary: Moves to the parent entity of the specified type.
member.param: The parent entity type to move to. Use bitwise-OR to specify multiple parent types.
member.remarks: This method is useful if you need to find the cell, column or header/footer parent of the entity.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Layout.LayoutEnumerator.Type
member.summary: Gets the type of the current entity.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Layout.LayoutEnumerator.Rectangle
member.summary: Returns the bounding rectangle of the current entity relative to the page top left corner (in points).

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Layout.LayoutEnumerator.Kind
member.summary: Gets the kind of the current entity. This can be an empty string but never null.
member.remarks: This is a more specific type of the current entity, e.g. bookmark span has type and may have either a BOOKMARKSTART or BOOKMARKEND kind.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Layout.LayoutEnumerator.Text
member.summary: Gets text of the current span entity. Throws for other entity types.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Layout.LayoutEnumerator.PageIndex
member.summary: Gets the 1-based index of a page which contains the current entity.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Layout.LayoutEnumerator.Current
member.summary: Gets or sets current position in the page layout model. This property returns an opaque object which corresponds to the current layout entity.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Layout.LayoutEnumerator.Document
member.summary: Gets document this instance enumerates.

summary.p: The Aspose.Words.Layout namespace provides classes that allow to access information such as on what page and where on a page particular document elements are positioned, when the document is formatted into pages.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.INodeChangingCallback.NodeRemoving(Aspose.Words.NodeChangingArgs)

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.INodeChangingCallback.NodeRemoved(Aspose.Words.NodeChangingArgs)

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.DigitalSignatureUtil
member.summary: Provides methods for signing document.

remarks.para: Since digital signature works with file content rather than Document Object Model these methods are put into a separate class.
Supported formats are and .

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.DigitalSignatureUtil.Sign(System.String,System.String,System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2,System.String,System.DateTime)
member.summary:
Signs source document using given digital signature and writes signed document to destination file.
Document should be either or .
member.param: The file name of the document to sign.
The file name of the signed document output.
Certificate object used to sign file. The certificate MUST contain private keys and have the X509KeyStorageFlags.Exportable flag set.
The reason for signing.
The date of signing.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.DigitalSignatureUtil.Sign(System.IO.Stream,System.IO.Stream,System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2,System.String,System.DateTime)
member.summary:
Signs source document using given digital signature and writes signed document to destination stream.
Document should be either or .
Output will be written to the start of stream and stream size will be updated with content length.
member.param: The stream which contains the document to sign.
The stream that signed document will be written to.
Certificate object used to sign file. The certificate MUST contain private keys and have the X509KeyStorageFlags.Exportable flag set.
The reason for signing.
The date of signing.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.DigitalSignatureUtil.RemoveAllSignatures(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Removes all digital signatures from source file and writes unsigned file to destination file.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.DigitalSignatureUtil.RemoveAllSignatures(System.IO.Stream,System.IO.Stream)
member.summary:
Removes all digital signatures from document in source stream and writes unsigned document to destination stream.
Output will be written to the start of stream and stream size will be updated with content length.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Saving.PdfImageColorSpaceExportMode
member.summary: Specifies how the color space will be selected for the images in PDF document.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Saving.PdfImageColorSpaceExportMode.Auto
member.summary: Aspose.Words automatically selects the most appropriate color space for each image.

remarks.para: Most of the images are saved in RGB color space. Also Indexed and Grayscale color spaces may be used. CMYK color space is never used.
For some images the color space may be different on different platforms.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Saving.PdfImageColorSpaceExportMode.SimpleCmyk
member.summary: Aspose.Words coverts RGB images to CMYK color space using simple formula.

remarks.para: Images in RGB color space are converted to CMYK using formula: Black = minimum(1-Red,1-Green,1-Blue). Cyan = (1-Red-Black)/(1-Black). Magenta = (1-Green-Black)/(1-Black). Yellow = (1-Blue-Black)/(1-Black). RGB values are normalized - they are between 0 and 1.0.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Saving.PdfCustomPropertiesExport
member.summary: Specifies the way are exported to PDF file.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Saving.PdfCustomPropertiesExport.None
member.summary: No custom properties are exported.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Saving.PdfCustomPropertiesExport.Standard
member.summary:
Custom properties are exported as entries in /Info dictionary.
Custom properties with the following names are not exported: "Title", "Author", "Subject", "Keywords", "Creator", "Producer", "CreationDate", "ModDate", "Trapped".

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Saving.PdfCustomPropertiesExport.Metadata
member.summary:
Custom properties are Metadata.
The namespace of exported properties in XMP packet is "custprops". Every property has an associated xml-element "custprops:Property1", "custprops:Property2" and so on. There is "rdf:Description" element inside property element. The description element has two elements "custprops:Name", containing custom property's name as a value of this xml-element, and "custprops:Value", containing custom property's value as value of this xml-element.

member.summary: Removes the whole field by the specified field start.

member.summary: Removes all fields of this collection from the document and from this collection itself.

member.summary: Returns the number of the fields in the collection.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Fields.FieldCollection.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a field at the specified index.

remarks.p: The index is zero-based.
Negative indexes are allowed and indicate access from the back of the collection. For example -1 means the last item, -2 means the second before last and so on.
If index is greater than or equal to the number of items in the list, this returns a null reference.
If index is negative and its absolute value is greater than the number of items in the list, this returns a null reference.

member.param: An index into the collection.

If the comparison is true, SKIPIF cancels the current merge document, moves to the next data record in the data source, and starts a new merge document. If the comparison is false, the current merge document is continued.

member.summary: Represents a single editable range.

remarks.p: is a "facade" object that encapsulates two nodes and in a document tree and allows to work with an editable range as a single object.

member.summary: Removes the editable range from the document. Does not remove content inside the editable range.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.EditableRange.Id
member.summary: Gets the editable range identifier.

remarks.para: The region must be demarcated using the and
Editable range identifiers are supposed to be unique across a document and Aspose.Words automatically maintains editable range identifiers when loading, saving and combining documents.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.EditableRange.SingleUser
member.summary: Returns or sets the single user for editable range.

remarks.p: This editor can be stored in one of the following forms:
DOMAIN\Username - for users whose access shall be authenticated using the current user's domain credentials.
user@domain.com - for users whose access shall be authenticated using the user's e-mail address as credentials.
user - for users whose access shall be authenticated using the current user's machine credentials.
Single user and editor group cannot be set simultaneously for the specific editable range, if the one is set, the other will be clear.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.EditableRange.EditorGroup
member.summary: Returns or sets an alias (or editing group) which shall be used to determine if the current user shall be allowed to edit this editable range.

remarks.p: Single user and editor group cannot be set simultaneously for the specific editable range, if the one is set, the other will be clear.

member.summary: Specifies the format in which the document will be saved if this save options object is used.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Saving.SaveOptions.TempFolder
member.summary: Specifies the folder for temporary files used when saving to a DOC or DOCX file. By default this property is null and no temporary files are used.

remarks.para: When Aspose.Words saves a document, it needs to create temporary internal structures. By default, these internal structures are created in memory and the memory usage spikes for a short period while the document is being saved. When saving is complete, the memory is freed and reclaimed by the garbage collector.

If you are saving a very large document (thousands of pages) and/or processing many documents at the same time, then the memory spike during saving can be significant enough to cause the system to throw . Specifying a temporary folder using will cause Aspose.Words to keep the internal structures in temporary files instead of memory. It reduces the memory usage during saving, but will decrease the save performance.
The folder must exist and be writable, otherwise an exception will be thrown.
Aspose.Words automatically deletes all temporary files when saving is complete.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Saving.SaveOptions.PrettyFormat
member.summary: When true, pretty formats output where applicable. Default value is false.

remarks.p: Set to true to make HTML, MHTML, EPUB, WordML, RTF, DOCX and ODT output human readable. Useful for testing or debugging.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Saving.SaveOptions.UseAntiAliasing
member.summary: Gets or sets a value determining whether or not to use anti-aliasing for rendering.

remarks.para: The default value is false. When this value is set to true anti-aliasing is used for rendering.
This property is used when the document is exported to the following formats: , , , . When the document is exported to the , and formats this option is used for raster images.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value determining the quality of the JPEG images inside PS document.

remarks.para: Has effect only when a document contains JPEG images.

The default value is 95.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Saving.ResourceSavingArgs
member.summary: Provides data for the event.

remarks.para: By default, when Aspose.Words saves a document to fixed page HTML or SVG, it saves each resource into a separate file. Aspose.Words uses the document file name and a unique number to generate unique file name for each resource found in the document.
allows to redefine how resource file names are generated or to completely circumvent saving of resources into files by providing your own stream objects.
To apply your own logic for generating resource file names use the property.
To save resources into streams instead of files, use the property.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Saving.ResourceSavingArgs.Document
member.summary: Gets the document object that is currently being saved.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Saving.ResourceSavingArgs.ResourceFileName
member.summary: Gets or sets the file name (without path) where the resource will be saved to.

remarks.para: This property allows you to redefine how the resource file names are generated during export to fixed page HTML or SVG.

When the event is fired, this property contains the file name that was generated by Aspose.Words. You can change the value of this property to save the resource into a different file. Note that file names must be unique.
remarks.p: Aspose.Words automatically generates a unique file name for every resource when exporting to fixed page HTML or SVG format. How the resource file name is generated depends on whether you save the document to a file or to a stream.
When saving a document to a file, the generated resource file name looks like <document base file name>.<image number>.<extension>.
When saving a document to a stream, the generated resource file name looks like Aspose.Words.<document guid>.<image number>.<extension>.
remarks.para: must contain only the file name without the path. Aspose.Words determines the path for saving and the value of the src attribute for writing to fixed page HTML or SVG using the document file name, the or and or properties.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Saving.ResourceSavingArgs.ResourceFileUri
member.summary: Gets or sets the uniform resource identifier (URI) used to reference the resource file from the document.

remarks.para: This property allows you to change URIs of resource files exported to fixed page HTML or SVG documents.

Aspose.Words automatically generates an URI for every resource file during export to fixed page HTML or SVG format. The generated URIs reference resource files saved by Aspose.Words. However, the URIs can be incorrect if resource files are to be moved to other location or if resource files are saved to streams. This property allows to correct URIs in these cases.
When the event is fired, this property contains the URI that was generated by Aspose.Words. You can change the value of this property to provide a custom URI for the resource file.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Saving.ResourceSavingArgs.KeepResourceStreamOpen
member.summary: Specifies whether Aspose.Words should keep the stream open or close it after saving a resource.

remarks.para: Default is false and Aspose.Words will close the stream you provided in the property after writing a resource into it. Specify true to keep the stream open.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Saving.ResourceSavingArgs.ResourceStream
member.summary: Allows to specify the stream where the resource will be saved to.

remarks.para: This property allows you to save resources to streams instead of files.
The default value is null. When this property is null, the resource will be saved to a file specified in the property.
Using you cannot substitute one resource with another. It is intended only for control over location where to save resources.

member.summary: Specifies the margins around pages in an HTML document. The margins value is measured in points and should be equal to or greater than 0. Default value is 10 points.

remarks.para: Depends on the value of property:

list.item: Defines top, bottom and left page margins if the value is .
Defines top, bottom and right page margins if the value is .
Defines top and bottom page margins if the value is .

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Saving.HtmlFixedSaveOptions.ResourcesFolder
member.summary: Specifies the physical folder where resources (images, fonts, css) are saved when exporting a document to Html format. Default is null.

remarks.p: Has effect only if property is false.

When you save a in Html format, Aspose.Words needs to save all images embedded in the document as standalone files. allows you to specify where the images will be saved and allows to specify how the image URIs will be constructed.
If you save a document into a file and provide a file name, Aspose.Words, by default, saves the images in the same folder where the document file is saved. Use to override this behavior.

If you save a document into a stream, Aspose.Words does not have a folder where to save the images, but still needs to save the images somewhere. In this case, you need to specify an accessible folder by using the property

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Saving.HtmlFixedSaveOptions.ResourcesFolderAlias
member.summary: Specifies the name of the folder used to construct image URIs written into an Html document. Default is null.

remarks.p: When you save a in Html format, Aspose.Words needs to save all images embedded in the document as standalone files. allows you to specify where the images will be saved and allows to specify how the image URIs will be constructed.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Saving.HtmlFixedSaveOptions.JpegQuality
member.summary: Gets or sets a value determining the quality of the JPEG images inside Html document.

remarks.para: Has effect only when a document contains JPEG images.
remarks.p: Use this property to get or set the quality of the images inside a document when saving in Html format. The value may vary from 0 to 100 where 0 means worst quality but maximum compression and 100 means best quality but minimum compression.
The default value is 95.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.RevisionCollection.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a Revision at the specified index.

remarks.p: The index is zero-based.
Negative indexes are allowed and indicate access from the back of the collection. For example -1 means the last item, -2 means the second before last and so on.
If index is greater than or equal to the number of items in the list, this returns a null reference.
If index is negative and its absolute value is greater than the number of items in the list, this returns a null reference.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Saving.CssSavingArgs
member.summary: Provides data for the event.

remarks.para: By default, when Aspose.Words saves a document to HTML, it saves CSS information inline (as a value of the style attribute on every element).
allows to save CSS information into file by providing your own stream object.
To save CSS into stream, use the property.
To suppress saving CSS into a file and embedding to HTML document use the property.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Saving.CssSavingArgs.Document
member.summary: Gets the document object that is currently being saved.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Saving.CssSavingArgs.KeepCssStreamOpen
member.summary: Specifies whether Aspose.Words should keep the stream open or close it after saving an CSS information.

remarks.para: Default is false and Aspose.Words will close the stream you provided in the property after writing an CSS information into it. Specify true to keep the stream open.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Saving.CssSavingArgs.CssStream
member.summary: Allows to specify the stream where the CSS information will be saved to.

remarks.para: This property allows you to save CSS information to a stream.
The default value is null. This property doesn't suppress saving CSS information to a file or embedding to HTML document. To suppress exporting CSS use the property.
Using you cannot substitute CSS with another. It is intended only for saving CSS to a stream.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Saving.CssSavingArgs.IsExportNeeded
member.summary: Allows to specify whether the CSS will be exported to file and embedded to HTML document. Default is true. When this property is false, the CSS information will not be saved to a CSS file and will not be embedded to HTML document.

member.summary: Implement this interface if you want to control how Aspose.Words saves CSS (Cascading Style Sheet) when saving a document to HTML.

member.summary: Specifies how Aspose.Words should render EMF+ Dual metafiles.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Saving.EmfPlusDualRenderingMode.EmfPlusWithFallback
member.summary: Aspose.Words tries to render EMF+ part of EMF+ Dual metafile. If some of the EMF+ records are not supported then Aspose.Words renders EMF part of EMF+ Dual metafile.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Saving.EmfPlusDualRenderingMode.EmfPlus
member.summary: Aspose.Words renders EMF+ part of EMF+ Dual metafile.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Saving.EmfPlusDualRenderingMode.Emf
member.summary: Aspose.Words renders EMF part of EMF+ Dual metafile.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Saving.MetafileRenderingOptions
member.summary: Allows to specify additional metafile rendering options.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Saving.MetafileRenderingOptions.RenderingMode
member.summary: Gets or sets a value determining how metafile images should be rendered.

remarks.para: The default value depends on the save format. For images it is . For other formats it is .

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Saving.MetafileRenderingOptions.EmfPlusDualRenderingMode
member.summary: Gets or sets a value determining how EMF+ Dual metafiles should be rendered.

remarks.para: EMF+ Dual metafiles contains both EMF+ and EMF parts. MS Word and GDI+ always renders EMF+ part. Aspose.Words currently doesn't fully supports all EMF+ records and in some cases rendering result of EMF part looks better then rendering result of EMF+ part.
remarks.p: This option is used only when metafile is rendered as vector graphics. When metafile is rendered to bitmap, EMF+ part is always used.
The default value is .

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Saving.MetafileRenderingOptions.UseEmfEmbeddedToWmf
member.summary: Gets or sets a value determining how WMF metafiles with embedded EMF metafiles should be rendered.

remarks.para: WMF metafiles could contain embedded EMF data. MS Word in most cases uses embedded EMF data. GDI+ always uses WMF data.
remarks.p: When this value is set to true, Aspose.Words uses embedded EMF data when rendering.
When this value is set to false, Aspose.Words uses WMF data when rendering.
This option is used only when metafile is rendered as vector graphics. When metafile is rendered to bitmap, WMF data is always used.
The default value is true.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Saving.MetafileRenderingOptions.EmulateRasterOperations
member.summary: Gets or sets a value determining whether or not the raster operations should be emulated.

remarks.para: Specific raster operations could be used in metafiles. They can not be rendered directly to vector graphics. Emulating raster operations requires partial rasterization of the resulting vector graphics which may affect the metafile rendering performance.
remarks.p: When this value is set to true, Aspose.Words emulates the raster operations. The resulting output maybe partially rasterized and performance might be slower.

When this value is set to false, Aspose.Words does not emulate the raster operations. When Aspose.Words encounters a raster operation in a metafile it fallbacks to rendering the metafile into a bitmap by using the operating system.
This option is used only when metafile is rendered as vector graphics.
The default value is true.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.FileFormatInfo
member.summary: Contains data returned by document format detection methods.

remarks.para: You do not create instances of this class directly. Objects of this class are returned by methods.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.FileFormatInfo.LoadFormat
member.summary: Gets the detected document format.

remarks.para: When an OOXML document is encrypted, it is not possible to ascertained whether it is an Excel, Word or PowerPoint document without decrypting it first so for an encrypted OOXML document this property will always return .

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.FileFormatInfo.IsEncrypted
member.summary: Returns true if the document is encrypted and requires a password to open.

remarks.para: This property exists to help you sort documents that are encrypted from those that are not. If you attempt to load an encrypted document using Aspose.Words without supplying a password an exception will be thrown. You can use this property to detect whether a document requires a password and take some action before loading a document, for example, prompt the user for a password.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.FileFormatInfo.HasDigitalSignature
member.summary: Returns true if this document contains a digital signature. This property merely informs that a digital signature is present on a document, but it does not specify whether the signature is valid or not.

remarks.para: This property exists to help you sort documents that are digitally signed from those that are not. If you use Aspose.Words to modify and save a document that is digitally signed, then the digital signature will be lost. This is by design because a digital signature exists to guard the authenticity of a document. Using this property you can detect digitally signed documents before processing them in the same way as normal documents and take some action to avoid losing the digital signature, for example notify the user.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.FileFormatInfo.Encoding
member.summary: Gets the detected encoding if applicable to the current document format. At the moment detects encoding only for HTML documents.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.LoadOptions
member.summary: Allows to specify additional options (such as password or base URI) when loading a document into a object.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.LoadOptions.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of this class with default values.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.LoadOptions.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: A shortcut to initialize a new instance of this class with the specified password to load an encrypted document.
member.param: The password to open an encrypted document. Can be null or empty string.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.LoadOptions.#ctor(Aspose.Words.LoadFormat,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: A shortcut to initialize a new instance of this class with properties set to the specified values.
member.param: The format of the document to be loaded.
The password to open an encrypted document. Can be null or empty string.
The string that will be used to resolve relative URIs to absolute. Can be null or empty string.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.LoadOptions.LoadFormat
member.summary: Specifies the format of the document to be loaded. Default is .

remarks.para: It is recommended that you specify the value and let Aspose.Words detect the file format automatically. If you know the format of the document you are about to load, you can specify the format explicitly and this will slightly reduce the loading time by the overhead associated with auto detecting the format. If you specify an explicit load format and it will turn out to be wrong, the auto detection will be invoked and a second attempt to load the file will be made.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.LoadOptions.Password
member.summary: Gets or sets the password for opening an encrypted document. Can be null or empty string. Default is null.

remarks.para: You need to know the password to open an encrypted document. If the document is not encrypted, set this to null or empty string.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.LoadOptions.BaseUri
member.summary: Gets or sets the string that will be used to resolve relative URIs found in the document into absolute URIs when required. Can be null or empty string. Default is null.

remarks.p: This property is used to resolve relative URIs into absolute in the following cases:

list.item: When loading an HTML document from a stream and the document contains images with relative URIs and does not have a base URI specified in the BASE HTML element.
When saving a document to PDF and other formats, to retrieve images linked using relative URIs so the images can be saved into the output document.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.LoadOptions.Encoding
member.summary: Gets or sets the encoding that will be used to load an HTML document if the encoding is not specified in HTML. Can be null. Default is null.

remarks.para: This property is used only when loading HTML documents.
If encoding is not specified in HTML and this property is null, then the system will try to automatically detect the encoding.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.LoadOptions.ResourceLoadingCallback
member.summary: Allows to control how external resources (images, style sheets) are loaded when a document is imported from HTML, MHTML.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.LoadOptions.WarningCallback
member.summary: Called during a load operation, when an issue is detected that might result in data or formatting fidelity loss.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.LoadOptions.PreserveIncludePictureField
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to preserve the INCLUDEPICTURE field when reading Microsoft Word formats. The default value is false.

remarks.p: By default, the INCLUDEPICTURE field is converted into a shape object. You can override that if you need the field to be preserved, for example, if you wish to update it programmatically. Note however that this approach is not common for Aspose.Words. Use it on your own risk.
One of the possible use cases may be using a MERGEFIELD as a child field to dynamically change the source path of the picture. In this case you need the INCLUDEPICTURE to be preserved in the model.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.LoadOptions.WebRequestTimeout
member.summary: The number of milliseconds to wait before the web request times out. The default value is 100000 milliseconds (100 seconds).
member.remarks: The number of milliseconds that Aspose.Words waits for a response, when loading external resources (images, style sheets) linked in HTML and MHTML documents.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.LoadOptions.AllowTrailingWhitespaceForListItems
member.summary: Allows to specify how numbered list items are recognized when document is imported from plain text format. The default value is true.

remarks.para: This property is used only when loading plain text documents.
If set to true, lists recognition algorithm allows list numbers to end with either dot or whitespace character.
If this option is set to false then the list item is only recognized as such if the leading number is ending with dot "." symbol.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.WarningInfo
member.summary: Contains information about a warning that Aspose.Words issued during document loading or saving.

remarks.para: You do not create instances of this class. Objects of this class are created and passed by Aspose.Words to the method.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.WarningInfo.WarningType
member.summary: Returns the type of the warning.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.WarningInfo.Description
member.summary: Returns the description of the warning.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.WarningInfo.Source
member.summary: Returns the source of the warning.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.WarningInfoCollection
member.summary: Represents a typed collection of objects.

remarks.para: You can use this collection object as the simplest form of implementation to gather all warnings that Aspose.Words generates during a load or save operation. Create an instance of this class and assign it to the or property.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.IWarningCallback
member.summary: Implement this interface if you want to have your own custom method called to capture loss of fidelity warnings that can occur during document loading or saving.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.IWarningCallback.Warning(Aspose.Words.WarningInfo)
member.summary: Aspose.Words invokes this method when it encounters some issue during document loading or saving that might result in loss of formatting or data fidelity.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Fields.FieldOptions
member.summary: Represents options to control field handling in a document.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Fields.FieldOptions.FieldUpdateCultureSource
member.summary: Specifies what culture to use to format the field result.

remarks.para: By default, the culture of the current thread is used.
The setting affects only date/time fields with \\@ format switch.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Fields.FieldOptions.IsBidiTextSupportedOnUpdate
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating whether bidirectional text is fully supported during field update or not.

remarks.para: When this property is set to true, additional steps are performed to produce Right-To-Left language (i.e. Arabic or Hebrew) compatible field result during its update.
When this property is set to false and Right-To-Left language is used, correctness of field result after its update is not guaranteed.
The default value is false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Fields.FieldOptions.UserPromptRespondent
member.summary: Gets or sets the respondent to user prompts during field update.

remarks.para: If the value of this property is set to null, the fields that require user response on prompting (such as ASK or FILLIN) are not updated.
The default value is null.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Fields.FieldOptions.DefaultDocumentAuthor
member.summary: Gets or sets default document author's name. If author's name is already specified in built-in document properties, this option is not considered.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Fields.FieldOptions.CustomTocStyleSeparator
member.summary: Gets or sets custom style separator for the \t switch in TOC field.
member.remarks: By default, custom styles defined by the \t switch in the TOC field are separated by a delimiter taken from the current culture. This property overrides that behaviour by specifying a user defined delimiter.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Fields.FieldOptions.LegacyNumberFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating whether legacy (early than AW 13.10) number format for fields is enabled or not.

remarks.para: When this property is set to true, template symbol "#" worked as in .net: Replaces the pound sign with the corresponding digit if one is present; otherwise, no symbols appears in the result string.

When this property is set to false, template symbol "#" works as MS Word: This format item specifies the requisite numeric places to display in the result. If the result does not include a digit in that place, MS Word displays a space. For example, { = 9 + 6 \# $### } displays $ 15.
The default value is false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Fields.FieldOptions.UseInvariantCultureNumberFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating that number format is parsed using invariant culture or not
member.para: When this property is set to true, number format is taken from an invariant culture.
When this property is set to false, number format is taken from the current thread's culture.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Fields.FieldOptions.BarcodeGenerator
member.summary: Gets or set custom barcode generator.
member.remarks: Custom barcode generator should implement public interface .

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Fields.FieldOptions.PreProcessCulture
member.summary: Gets or sets the culture to preprocess field values.

remarks.p: Currently this property only affects value of the DOCPROPERTY field.
The default value is null. When this property is set to null, the DOCPROPERTY field's value is preprocessed with the culture controlled by the property.

Implements the MACROBUTTON field.
Allows a macro or command to be run.
In Aspose.Words this field can also act as a merge field.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Fields.FieldMacroButton.DisplayText

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Fields.FieldMergeField
member.summary: Implements the MERGEFIELD field.
member.remarks: Retrieves the name of a data field within the merge characters in a mail merge main document. When the main document is merged with the selected data source, information from the specified data field is inserted in place of the merge field.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Fields.FieldMergeField.FieldNameNoPrefix
member.summary: Returns just the name of the data field. Any prefix is stripped to the prefix property.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Fields.FieldMergeField.FieldName
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of a data field.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Fields.FieldMergeField.TextBefore
member.summary: Gets or sets the text to be inserted before the field if the field is not blank.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Fields.FieldMergeField.TextAfter
member.summary: Gets or sets the text to be inserted after the field if the field is not blank.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Fields.FieldMergeField.IsMapped
member.summary: Gets or sets whether this field is a mapped field.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Fields.FieldMergeField.IsVerticalFormatting
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to enable character conversion for vertical formatting.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Fields.FieldMergeRec
member.summary: Implements the MERGEREC field.
member.remarks: At the moment the MERGEREC and MERGESEQ fields implement the same functionality because we don't know for sure how to skip records in Aspose.Words mail merge.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Fields.FieldMergeSeq
member.summary: Implements the MERGESEQ field.
member.remarks: At the moment the MERGEREC and MERGESEQ fields implement the same functionality because we don't know for sure how to skip records in Aspose.Words mail merge.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Fields.FieldNext
member.summary: Implements the NEXT field.
member.remarks: Merges the next data record into the current resulting merged document, rather than starting a new merged document.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Fields.FieldNextIf
member.summary: Implements the NEXTIF field.
member.remarks: Compares the values designated by the expressions and in comparison using the operator designated by . If the comparison is true, the next data record is merged into the current merge document. (Merge fields that follow the NEXTIF in the main document are replaced by values from the next data record rather than the current data record.) If the comparison is false, the next data record is merged into a new merge document.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Fields.FieldNextIf.LeftExpression
member.summary: Gets or sets the left part of the comparison expression.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Fields.FieldNextIf.ComparisonOperator
member.summary: Gets or sets the comparison operator.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Fields.FieldNextIf.RightExpression
member.summary: Gets or sets the right part of the comparison expression.

summary.para: Specifies format of particular embedded font inside object.
When saving a document to a file, only embedded fonts of corresponding format are written down.
Specifies Embedded OpenType (EOT) File Format.
This format of embedded fonts used in DOC files.

remarks.para: See http://www.w3.org/Submission/EOT for description of the format.

summary.para: Specifies font, embedded as plain copy of OpenType (TrueType) font file.
This format of embedded fonts used in Open Office XML format, including DOCX files.

member.summary: Returns the font source priority.

remarks.para: This value is used when there are fonts with the same family name and style in different font sources. In this case Aspose.Words selects the font from the source with the higher priority value.
The default value is 0.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Markup.StructuredDocumentTag
member.summary: Represents a structured document tag (SDT or content control) in a document.

remarks.para: Structured document tags (SDTs) allow to embed customer-defined semantics as well as its behavior and appearance into a document.

In this version of Aspose.Words provides a number of public methods and properties to manipulate the behavior and content of . However databinding of SDT nodes to custom xml packages within a Document is not supported in this version of public API.
can occur in a document in the following places:

list.item: Block-level - Among paragraphs and tables, as a child of a , , , or a node.
Row-level - Among rows in a table, as a child of a node.
Cell-level - Among cells in a table row, as a child of a node.
Inline-level - Among inline content inside, as a child of a .
Nested inside another .

member.remarks: Can be null, meaning that the placeholder is not applicable for this Sdt.

BuildingBlock with this name has to be present in the otherwise will occur.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Markup.StructuredDocumentTag.Level
member.summary: Gets the level at which this SDT occurs in the document tree.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Markup.StructuredDocumentTag.SdtType
member.summary: Gets type of this Structured document tag.

summary.para: Specifies a unique readonly persistent numerical Id for this SDT.

remarks.para:
Id attribute shall follow these rules:
The document shall retain SDT ids if the whole document is cloned .
During Id shall be retained if import does not cause conflicts with other SDT Ids in the target document.
If multiple SDT nodes specify the same decimal number value for the Id attribute, then the first SDT in the document shall maintain this original Id, and all subsequent SDT nodes shall have new identifiers assigned to them when the document is loaded.
During operation new unique ID will be generated for the cloned SDT node.
If Id is not specified in the source document, then the SDT node shall have a new unique identifier assigned to it when the document is loaded.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Markup.StructuredDocumentTag.LockContentControl
member.summary: When set to true, this property will prohibit a user from deleting this SDT.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Markup.StructuredDocumentTag.LockContents
member.summary: When set to true, this property will prohibit a user from editing the contents of this SDT.

summary.para: Specifies whether the content of this SDT shall be interpreted to contain placeholder text (as opposed to regular text contents within the SDT).
if set to true, this state shall be resumed (showing placeholder text) upon opening this document.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Markup.SdtCalendarType
member.summary: Specifies the possible types of calendars which can be used to specify in an Office Open XML document.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Markup.SdtCalendarType.Default
member.summary: Used as default value in OOXML. Equals .

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Markup.SdtCalendarType.Gregorian
member.summary: Specifies that the Gregorian calendar, as defined in ISO 8601, shall be used. This calendar should be localized into the appropriate language.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Markup.SdtCalendarType.GregorianArabic
member.summary: Specifies that the Gregorian calendar, as defined in ISO 8601, shall be used. The values for this calendar should be presented in Arabic.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Markup.SdtCalendarType.GregorianMeFrench
member.summary: Specifies that the Gregorian calendar, as defined in ISO 8601, shall be used. The values for this calendar should be presented in Middle East French.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Markup.SdtCalendarType.GregorianUs
member.summary: Specifies that the Gregorian calendar, as defined in ISO 8601, shall be used. The values for this calendar should be presented in English.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Markup.SdtCalendarType.GregorianXlitEnglish
member.summary: Specifies that the Gregorian calendar, as defined in ISO 8601, shall be used. The values for this calendar should be the representation of the English strings in the corresponding Arabic characters (the Arabic transliteration of the English for the Gregorian calendar).

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Markup.SdtCalendarType.GregorianXlitFrench
member.summary: Specifies that the Gregorian calendar, as defined in ISO 8601, shall be used. The values for this calendar should be the representation of the French strings in the corresponding Arabic characters (the Arabic transliteration of the French for the Gregorian calendar).

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Markup.SdtCalendarType.Hebrew
member.summary: Specifies that the Hebrew lunar calendar, as described by the Gauss formula for Passover [CITATION] and The Complete Restatement of Oral Law (Mishneh Torah),shall be used.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Markup.SdtCalendarType.Hijri
member.summary: Specifies that the Hijri lunar calendar, as described by the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia, Ministry of Islamic Affairs, Endowments, Da‘wah and Guidance, shall be used.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Markup.SdtCalendarType.Japan
member.summary: Specifies that the Japanese Emperor Era calendar, as described by Japanese Industrial Standard JIS X 0301, shall be used.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Markup.SdtCalendarType.Korea
member.summary: Specifies that the Korean Tangun Era calendar, as described by Korean Law Enactment No. 4, shall be used.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Markup.SdtCalendarType.None
member.summary: Specifies that no calendar should be used.
member.remarks: Usually in AW, None is the first and default value for enums, but not in this case. None is not default for OOXML, instead is default and is first member of this enum.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Markup.SdtCalendarType.Saka
member.summary: Specifies that the Saka Era calendar, as described by the Calendar Reform Committee of India, as part of the Indian Ephemeris and Nautical Almanac, shall be used.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Markup.SdtCalendarType.Taiwan
member.summary: Specifies that the Taiwanese calendar, as defined by the Chinese National Standard CNS 7648, shall be used.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Markup.SdtCalendarType.Thai
member.summary: Specifies that the Thai calendar, as defined by the Royal Decree of H.M. King Vajiravudh (Rama VI) in Royal Gazette B. E. 2456 (1913 A.D.) and by the decree of Prime Minister Phibunsongkhram (1941 A.D.) to start the year on the Gregorian January 1 and to map year zero to Gregorian year 543 B.C., shall be used.

member.summary: Removes the bookmark from the document. Does not remove text inside the bookmark.

member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the bookmark.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.BookmarkEnd
member.summary: Represents an end of a bookmark in a Word document.

remarks.p: A complete bookmark in a Word document consists of a and a matching with the same bookmark name.
and are just markers inside a document that specify where the bookmark starts and ends.
Use the class as a "facade" to work with a bookmark as a single object.
remarks.note: Currently bookmarks are supported only at the inline-level, that is inside , but bookmark start and bookmark end can be in different paragraphs.

member.summary: Specifies line style of a .

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.LineStyle.None
member.dev:
In MS Word binary format LineStyle.None means no border for all objects, except table cells.
For table cells LineStyle.None means inherit from the default table border.
Apparently this looks like a very bad hack made by someone at MS and I work around it by making LineStyle.None to mean "no border" for any object in the model including table cells. The translation is performed in the binary cell reader/writer.
I also use a single approach to indicate that a border is inherited. At first the border attribute is simply missing, but if a use requests it, a Border object is instantiated in "inherited" mode.
DS 12.10.2010. Right now the enum contains the continuous range of values and it is used in Border.HasValidLineStyle to define if a line style belongs to the enum or not. If new values are added to the enum then Border.HasValidLineStyle should be reworked correspondingly.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.NodeCollection
member.summary: Represents a collection of nodes of a specific type.

remarks.p: NodeCollection does not own the nodes it contains, rather, is just a selection of nodes of the specified type, but the nodes are stored in the tree under their respective parent nodes.
NodeCollection supports indexed access, iteration and provides add and remove methods.

The NodeCollection collection is "live", i.e. changes to the children of the node object that it was created from are immediately reflected in the nodes returned by the NodeCollection properties and methods.
NodeCollection is returned by and also serves as a base class for typed node collections such as , etc.
NodeCollection can be "flat" and contain only immediate children of the node it was created from, or it can be "deep" and contain all descendant children.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.NodeCollection.Add(Aspose.Words.Node)
member.summary: Adds a node to the end of the collection.

remarks.p: The node is inserted as a child into the node object from which the collection was created.
If the newChild is already in the tree, it is first removed.
If the node being inserted was created from another document, you should use to import the node to the current document. The imported node can then be inserted into the current document.

member.param: The node to be added to the end of the collection.
member.exception: The NodeCollection is a "deep" collection.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.NodeCollection.Insert(System.Int32,Aspose.Words.Node)
member.summary: Inserts a node into the collection at the specified index.

remarks.p: The node is inserted as a child into the node object from which the collection was created.
If the index is equal to or greater than Count, the node is added at the end of the collection.
If the index is negative and its absolute value is greater than Count, the node is added at the end of the collection.
If the newChild is already in the tree, it is first removed.
If the node being inserted was created from another document, you should use to import the node to the current document. The imported node can then be inserted into the current document.

member.param: The zero-based index of the node. Negative indexes are allowed and indicate access from the back of the list. For example -1 means the last node, -2 means the second before last and so on.
The node to insert.
member.exception: The NodeCollection is a "deep" collection.
