member.name: T:Aspose.Words.MailMerging.IMailMergeDataSourceRoot
member.summary: Implement this interface to allow mail merge from a custom data source with master-detail data.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.MailMerging.IMailMergeDataSourceRoot.GetDataSource(System.String)
member.summary: The Aspose.Words mail merge engine invokes this method when it encounters a beginning of a top-level mail merge region.

remarks.para: When the Aspose.Words mail merge engines populates a document with data and encounters MERGEFIELD TableStart:TableName, it invokes on this object. Your implementation needs to return a new data source object. Aspose.Words will use the returned data source to populate the mail merge region.
If a data source (table) with the specified name does not exist, your implementation should return null.

member.param: The name of the mail merge region as specified in the template document. Case-insensitive.
member.returns: A data source object that will provide access to the data records of the specified table.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Settings.Odso
member.summary: Specifies the Office Data Source Object (ODSO) settings for a mail merge data source.

remarks.para: ODSO seems to be the "new" way the newer Microsoft Word versions prefer to use when specifying certain types of data sources for a mail merge document. ODSO probably first appeared in Microsoft Word 2000.

The use of ODSO is poorly documented and the best way to learn how to use the properies of this object is to create a document with a desired data source manually in Microsoft Word and then open that document using Aspose.Words and examine the properties of the and objects. This is a good approach to take if you want to learn how to programmatically configure a data source, for example.
You do not normally need to create objects of this class directly because ODSO settings are always available via the property.

remarks.para: RK I have never seen this in use.

member.summary: Specifies the type of the external data source to be connected to as part of the ODSO connection information for this mail merge. The default value is .

member.summary: Gets or sets a collection of objects that specify inclusion/exclusion of individual records in the mail merge. This object is never null.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Settings.OdsoRecipientData
member.summary: Represents information about a single record within an external data source that is to be excluded from the mail merge.

remarks.para: If a record shall be merged into a merged document, then no information is needed about that record. However, if a given record shall not be merged into a merged document, then the value of the unique key for that record shall be stored in the property of this object to indicate this exclusion.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Themes.Theme
member.summary: Represents document Theme, and provides access to main theme parts including , and
member.dev:
At the moment this is just a crude hack to preserve themes during DOCX to DOCX roundtrip, but later should be worked into a more appropriate object.
WORDSNET-10513. Limited support for theme handling was implemented. If customer changes one of theme part then theme is rewritten with new values. If theme is unchanged during roundtrip then it is written raw as before.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.TableStyle
member.summary: Represents a table style.
member.dev: It is interesting to note that all attribute collections in the style are not supposed to contain attributes that reference another style. E.g. TablePr of the style should not contain Istd of a table style. It is actually a good thing. The only problem is that we do not validate it and maybe reading from some formats could leave Istd in these collections.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Style
member.summary: Represents a single built-in or user-defined style.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Style.Remove
member.summary: Removes the specified style from the document.
member.remarks:
Style removal has following effects on the document model:
All references to the style are removed from corresponding paragraphs, runs and tables.
If base style is removed its formatting is moved to child styles.
If style to be deleted has a linked style, then both of these are deleted.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Style.Equals(Aspose.Words.Style)
member.summary: Compares with the specified style. Styles Istds are compared for built-in styles only. Styles defaults are not included in comparison. Base style, linked style and next paragraph style are recursively compared.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Style.Equals(Aspose.Words.Style,Aspose.Collections.HashSet)
member.summary: Compares with the specified style considering base, linked and next paragraph styles. Uses HashSet to check already compared styles to avoid dead loops in linked and next styles.

member.summary: True to disable UI functionality which is not compatible with Word97-2003. Default value is false.
member.remarks:
Controls the Word97-2003 compatibility setting that disables UI functionality which is not compatible with Word97-2003. When true, 'w:uiCompat97To2003' XML element is written to '\word\settings.xml' document package part. Default value is false. When set to false, this element is not written.
Technically this property is not part of compatibility options, but we have put it here for API convenience.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Document
member.summary: Represents a Word document.

remarks.p: The Document is a central object in the Aspose.Words library.
To load an existing document in any of the formats, pass a file name or a stream into one of the Document constructors. To create a blank document, call the constructor without parameters.
Use one of the Save method overloads to save the document in any of the formats.
remarks.para: To draw document pages directly onto a Graphics object use or method.
To print the document, use one of the methods.
remarks.p: is the Aspose.Words's reporting engine that allows to populate reports designed in Microsoft Word with data from various data sources quickly and easily. The data can be from a DataSet, DataTable, DataView, IDataReader or an array of values. MailMerge will go through the records found in the data source and insert them into mail merge fields in the document growing it as necessary.
Document stores document-wide information such as , , , lists and macros. Most of these objects are accessible via the corresponding properties of the Document.

The Document is a root node of a tree that contains all other nodes of the document. The tree is a Composite design pattern and in many ways similar to XmlDocument. The content of the document can be manipulated freely programmatically:

list.item: The nodes of the document can be accessed via typed collections, for example , etc.

The nodes of the document can be selected by their node type using
or using an XPath query with or .
Content nodes can be added or removed from anywhere in the document using , , and other methods provided by the base class .
The formatting attributes of each node can be changed via the properties of that node.

remarks.p: Consider using that simplifies the task of programmatically creating or populating the document tree.
The Document can contain only objects.
In Microsoft Word, a valid document needs to have at least one section.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Document.Protect(Aspose.Words.ProtectionType)
member.overloads: Protects the document from changes.
member.summary: Protects the document from changes without changing the existing password or assigns a random password.

remarks.p: When a document is protected, the user can make only limited changes, such as adding annotations, making revisions, or completing a form.
When you protect a document, and the document already has a protection password, the existing protection password is not changed.

When you protect a document, and the document does not have a protection password, this method assigns a random password that makes it impossible to unprotect the document in Microsoft Word, but you still can unprotect the document in Aspose.Words as it does not require a password when unprotecting.

member.param: Specifies the protection type for the document.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Document.Protect(Aspose.Words.ProtectionType,System.String)
member.summary: Protects the document from changes and optionally sets a protection password.

remarks.p: When a document is protected, the user can make only limited changes, such as adding annotations, making revisions, or completing a form.
remarks.para: Note that document protection is different from write protection. Write protection is specified using the .

member.param: Specifies the protection type for the document.
The password to protect the document with. Specify null or empty string if you want to protect the document without a password.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Document.Unprotect
member.overloads: Removes protection from the document.
member.summary: Removes protection from the document regardless of the password.

remarks.para: This method unprotects the document even if it has a protection password.
Note that document protection is different from write protection. Write protection is specified using the .

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Document.Unprotect(System.String)
member.summary: Removes protection from the document if a correct password is specified.

remarks.para: This method unprotects the document only if a correct password is specified.
Note that document protection is different from write protection. Write protection is specified using the .

member.param: The password to unprotect the document with.
member.returns: True if a correct password was specified and the document was unprotected.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Document.UpdateWordCount
member.summary: Updates word count properties of the document.

remarks.p: UpdateWordCount recalculates and updates Characters, Words and Paragraphs properties in the collection of the Document.
Note that UpdateWordCount does not update number of lines and pages properties.
When you use an evaluation version, the evaluation watermark will also be included in the word count.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Document.UpdateTableLayout
member.summary: Updates widths of cells and tables in the document according to their preferred widths and content. You do not need to call this method if the tables appear correct in the output document.

remarks.p: You do not normally need to call this method as cell and table widths are maintained automatically. You can call this method before exporting to PDF (or any other fixed-page format), only in rare cases where you confirmed that tables appear incorrectly laid out in the output document. Calling this method might help to correct the output.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Document.UpdateListLabels
member.summary: Updates list labels for all list items in the document.

remarks.para: This method updates list label properties such as and for each object in the document.

Also, this method is sometimes implicitly called when updating fields in the document. This is required because some fields that may reference list numbers (such as TOC or REF) need them be up-to-date.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Document.RemoveMacros
member.summary: Removes all macros (the VBA project) as well as toolbars and command customizations from the document.

remarks.p: By removing all macros from a document you can ensure the document contains no macro viruses.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Document.UpdateFields
member.summary: Updates the values of fields in the whole document.

remarks.para: When you open, modify and then save a document, Aspose.Words does not update fields automatically, it keeps them intact. Therefore, you would usually want to call this method before saving if you have modified the document programmatically and want to make sure the proper (calculated) field values appear in the saved document.
There is no need to update fields after executing a mail merge because mail merge is a kind of field update and automatically updates all fields in the document.
remarks.p: This method does not update all field types. For the detailed list of supported field types, see the Programmers Guide.
remarks.para: This method does not update fields that are related to the page layout algorithms (e.g. PAGE, PAGES, PAGEREF). The page layout-related fields are updated when you render a document or call .
To update fields in a specific part of the document use .

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Document.JoinRunsWithSameFormatting
member.summary: Joins runs with same formatting in all paragraphs of the document.

remarks.p: This is an optimization method. Some documents contain adjacent runs with same formatting. Usually this occurs if a document was intensively edited manually. You can reduce the document size and speed up further processing by joining these runs.

The operation checks every node in the document for adjacent nodes having identical properties. It ignores unique identifiers used to track editing sessions of run creation and modification. First run in every joining sequence accumulates all text. Remaining runs are deleted from the document.

member.returns: Number of joins performed. When N adjacent runs are being joined they count as N - 1 joins.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Document.ExpandTableStylesToDirectFormatting
member.summary: Converts formatting specified in table styles into direct formatting on tables in the document.

remarks.para: This method exists because this version of Aspose.Words provides only limited support for table styles (see below). This method might be useful when you load a DOCX or WordprocessingML document that contains tables formatted with table styles and you need to query formatting of tables, cells, paragraphs or text.
This version of Aspose.Words provides limited support for table styles as follows:

list.item: Table styles defined in DOCX or WordprocessingML documents are preserved as table styles when saving the document as DOCX or WordprocessingML.
Table styles defined in DOCX or WordprocessingML documents are automatically converted to direct formatting on tables when saving the document into any other format, rendering or printing.
Table styles defined in DOC documents are preserved as table styles when saving the document as DOC only.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Document.RemoveUnusedResources

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Document.RemoveExternalSchemaReferences

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Document.StartTrackRevisions(System.String,System.DateTime)
member.summary: Starts automatically marking all further changes you make to the document programmatically as revision changes.

remarks.p: If you call this method and then make some changes to the document programmatically, save the document and later open the document in MS Word you will see these changes as revisions.
Currently Aspose.Words supports tracking of node insertions and deletions only. Formatting changes are not recorded as revisions.
Automatic tracking of changes is supported both when modifying this document through node manipulations as well as when using
This method does not change the option and does not use its value for the purposes of revision tracking.

member.param: Initials of the author to use for revisions.
The date and time to use for revisions.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Document.UpdatePageLayout
member.summary: Rebuilds the page layout of the document.

remarks.para: This method formats a document into pages and updates the page number related fields in the document such as PAGE, PAGES, PAGEREF and REF. The up-to-date page layout information is required for a correct rendering of the document to fixed-page formats.

This method is automatically invoked when you first convert a document to PDF, XPS, image or print it. However, if you modify the document after rendering and then attempt to render it again - Aspose.Words will not update the page layout automatically. In this case you should call before rendering again.

These digital signatures will not be saved when you save this object into a file or stream because saving or converting will produce a document that is different from the original and the original digital signatures will no longer be valid.
This collection is never null. If the document is not signed, it will contain zero elements.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.DocumentBuilder
member.summary: Provides methods to insert text, images and other content, specify font, paragraph and section formatting.

remarks.p: DocumentBuilder makes the process of building a Document easier. Document is a composite object consisting of a tree of nodes and while inserting content nodes directly into the tree is possible, it requires good understanding of the tree structure. DocumentBuilder is a "facade" for the complex structure of Document and allows to insert content and formatting quickly and easily.
Create a DocumentBuilder and associate it with a .

The DocumentBuilder has an internal cursor where the text will be inserted when you call , , and other methods. You can navigate the DocumentBuilder cursor to a different location in a document using various MoveToXXX methods.
Use the property to specify character formatting that will apply to all text inserted from the current position in the document onwards.
Use the property to specify paragraph formatting for the current and all paragraphs that will be inserted.
Use the property to specify page and section properties for the current section and all section that will be inserted.
Use the and properties to specify formatting properties for table cells and rows. User the and methods to build a table.
Note that Font, ParagraphFormat and PageSetup properties are updated whenever you navigate to a different place in the document to reflect formatting properties available at the new location.

remarks.p: When sectionIndex is greater than or equal to 0, it specifies an index from the beginning of the document with 0 being the first section. When sectionIndex is less than 0, it specified an index from the end of the document with -1 being the last section.
The cursor is moved to the first paragraph in the Body of the specified section.

member.param: The index of the section to move to.

remarks.p: After you moved the cursor into a header or footer, you can use the rest of DocumentBuilder methods to modify the contents of the header or footer.
If you want to create headers and footers different for the first page, you need to set .
If you want to create headers and footers different for even and odd pages, you need to set .
Use to move out of the header into the main text.

member.param: Specifies the header or footer to move to.

When true, moves the cursor to be after the field end. When false, moves the cursor to be before the field start.

member.summary: Moves the cursor to a field in the document.

When true, moves the cursor to be after the field end. When false, moves the cursor to be before the field start.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.DocumentBuilder.MoveToBookmark(System.String)
member.summary: Moves the cursor to a bookmark.

remarks.p: Moves the cursor to a position just after the start of the bookmark with the specified name.
The comparison is not case-sensitive. If the bookmark was not found, false is returned and the cursor is not moved.
Inserting new text does not replace existing text of the bookmark.

Note that some bookmarks in the document are assigned to form fields. Moving to such a bookmark and inserting text there inserts the text into the form field code. Although this will not invalidate the form field, the inserted text will not be visible because it becomes part of the field code.

member.param: The name of the bookmark to move the cursor to.
member.returns: True if the bookmark was found; false otherwise.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.DocumentBuilder.MoveToBookmark(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Moves the cursor to a bookmark with greater precision.

remarks.p: Moves the cursor to a position before or after the bookmark start or end.
The comparison is not case-sensitive. If the bookmark was not found, false is returned and the cursor is not moved.

member.param: The name of the bookmark to move the cursor to.
When true, moves the cursor to the beginning of the bookmark. When false, moves the cursor to the end of the bookmark.
When true, moves the cursor to be after the bookmark start or end position. When false, moves the cursor to be before the bookmark start or end position.
member.returns: True if the bookmark was found; false otherwise.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.DocumentBuilder.MoveToParagraph(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Moves the cursor to a paragraph in the current section.

remarks.p: The navigation is performed inside the current story of the current section. That is, if you moved the cursor to the primary header of the first section, then paragraphIndex specified the index of the paragraph inside that header of that section.

When paragraphIndex is greater than or equal to 0, it specifies an index from the beginning of the section with 0 being the first paragraph. When paragraphIndex is less than 0, it specified an index from the end of the section with -1 being the last paragraph.

member.param: The index of the paragraph to move to.
The index of the character inside the paragraph. Currently can only specify 0 to move to the beginning of the paragraph or -1 to move to the end of the paragraph.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.DocumentBuilder.MoveToCell(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Moves the cursor to a table cell in the current section.

remarks.p: The navigation is performed inside the current story of the current section.

For the index parameters, when index is greater than or equal to 0, it specifies an index from the beginning with 0 being the first element. When index is less than 0, it specified an index from the end with -1 being the last element.

member.param: The index of the table to move to.
The index of the row in the table.
The index of the column in the table.
The index of the character inside the cell. Currently can only specify 0 to move to the beginning of the cell or -1 to move to the end of the cell.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.DocumentBuilder.MoveTo(Aspose.Words.Paragraph,Aspose.Words.Node)
member.summary: If inline node is not null, moves to it, otherwise moves to the paragraph node.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.DocumentBuilder.MoveTo(Aspose.Words.Node)
member.summary: Moves the cursor to an inline node or to the end of a paragraph.

remarks.p: When node is an inline-level node, the cursor is moved to this node and further content will be inserted before that node.
When node is a Paragraph, the cursor is moved to the end of the paragraph and further content will be inserted just before the paragraph break.

member.param: The node must be a paragraph or a direct child of a paragraph.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.DocumentBuilder.DeleteRow(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Deletes a row from a table.

remarks.p: If the cursor is inside the row that is being deleted, the cursor is moved out to the next row or to the next paragraph after the table.
If you delete a row from a table that contains only one row, the whole table is deleted.

For the index parameters, when index is greater than or equal to 0, it specifies an index from the beginning with 0 being the first element. When index is less than 0, it specified an index from the end with -1 being the last element.

member.param: The index of the table.
The index of the row in the table.
member.returns: The row node that was just removed.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.DocumentBuilder.InsertTableOfContents(System.String)
member.summary: Inserts a TOC (table of contents) field into the document.

remarks.p: This method inserts a TOC (table of contents) field into the document at the current position.

A table of contents in a Word document can be built in a number of ways and formatted using a variety of options. The way the table is built and displayed by Microsoft Word is controlled by the field switches.

The easiest way to specify the switches is to insert and configure a table of contents into a Word document using the Insert->Reference->Index and Tables menu, then switch display of field codes on to see the switches. You can press Alt+F9 in Microsoft Word to toggle display of field codes on or off.
For example, after creating a table of contents, the following field is inserted into the document: { TOC \o "1-3" \h \z \u }. You can copy \o "1-3" \h \z \u and use it as the switches parameter.
Note that InsertTableOfContents will only insert a TOC field, but will not actually build the table of contents. The table of contents is built by Microsoft Word when the field is updated.
If you insert a table of contents using this method and then open the file in Microsoft Word, you will not see the table of contents because the TOC field has not yet been updated.
In Microsoft Word, fields are not automatically updated when a document is opened, but you can update fields in a document at any time by pressing F9.

member.param: The TOC field switches.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.DocumentBuilder.InsertField(Aspose.Words.Fields.FieldType,System.Boolean)
member.overloads: Inserts a Word field into a document.
member.summary: Inserts a Word field into a document and optionally updates the field result.

remarks.para: This method inserts a field into a document. Aspose.Words can update fields of most types, but not all. For more details see the overload.

member.param: The type of the field to append.
Specifies whether to update the field immediately.
member.returns: A object that represents the inserted field.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.DocumentBuilder.InsertField(System.String)
member.overloads: Inserts a Word field into a document.
member.summary: Inserts a Word field into a document and updates the field result.

remarks.para: This method inserts a field into a document and updates the field result immediately. Aspose.Words can update fields of most types, but not all. For more details see the overload.

member.param: The field code to insert (without curly braces).
member.returns: A object that represents the inserted field.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.DocumentBuilder.InsertField(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Inserts a Word field into a document without updating the field result.

remarks.p: Fields in Microsoft Word documents consist of a field code and a field result. The field code is like a formula and the field result is like the value that the formula produces. The field code may also contain field switches that are like additional instructions to perform a specific action.
You can switch between displaying field codes and results in your document in Microsoft Word using the keyboard shortcut Alt+F9. Field codes appear between curly braces ( { } ).

To create a field, you need to specify a field type, field code and a "placeholder" field value. If you are not sure about a particular field code syntax, create the field in Microsoft Word first and switch to see its field code.
remarks.para: Aspose.Words can calculate field results for most of the field types, but this method does not update the field result automatically. Because the field result is not calculated automatically, you are expected to pass some string value (or even an empty string) that will be inserted into the field result. This value will remain in the field result as a placeholder until the field is updated. To update the field result you can call on the field object returned to you or to update fields in the whole document.

member.param: The field code to insert (without curly braces).
The field value to insert. Pass null for fields that do not have a value.
member.returns: A object that represents the inserted field.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.DocumentBuilder.InsertHyperlink(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Inserts a hyperlink into the document.

remarks.p: Note that you need to specify font formatting for the hyperlink display text explicitly using the property.

member.param: Text of the link to be displayed in the document.
Link destination. Can be a url or a name of a bookmark inside the document. This method always adds apostrophes at the beginning and end of the url.
True if the previous parameter is a name of a bookmark inside the document; false is the previous parameter is a URL.
member.returns: A object that represents the inserted field.

member.summary: Ends a table row in the document.

remarks.p: Call EndRow to end a table row. If you call immediately after that, then the table continues on a new row.
Use the property to specify row formatting.

member.returns: The row node that was just finished.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.DocumentBuilder.StartBookmark(System.String)
member.summary: Marks the current position in the document as a bookmark start.

remarks.p: Bookmarks in a document can overlap and span any range. To create a valid bookmark you need to call both and with the same bookmarkName parameter.
Badly formed bookmarks or bookmarks with duplicate names will be ignored when the document is saved.

member.param: Name of the bookmark.
member.returns: The bookmark start node that was just created.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.DocumentBuilder.EndBookmark(System.String)

Badly formed bookmarks or bookmarks with duplicate names will be ignored when the document is saved.

member.param: Name of the bookmark.
member.returns: The bookmark end node that was just created.

member.remarks: This method mimics the MS Word behavior, as if CTRL+'A' (select all content) was pressed, then CTRL+'C' (copy selected into the buffer) inside one document and then CTRL+'V' (insert content from the buffer) inside another document.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Saving.ImageSavingArgs
member.summary: Provides data for the event.

remarks.para: By default, when Aspose.Words saves a document to HTML, it saves each image into a separate file. Aspose.Words uses the document file name and a unique number to generate unique file name for each image found in the document.
allows to redefine how image file names are generated or to completely circumvent saving of images into files by providing your own stream objects.
To apply your own logic for generating image file names use the , and properties.
To save images into streams instead of files, use the property.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Saving.ImageSavingArgs.Document
member.summary: Gets the document object that is currently being saved.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Saving.ImageSavingArgs.CurrentShape
member.summary: Gets the object corresponding to the shape or group shape that is about to be saved.

remarks.para: can be fired while saving either a shape or a group shape. That's why the property has type. You can check whether it's a group shape comparing with or by casting it to one of derived classes: or .

Aspose.Words uses the document file name and a unique number to generate unique file name for each image found in the document. You can use the property to generate a "better" file name by examining shape properties such as (Shape only), (Shape only) and . Of course you can build file names using any other properties or criteria but note that subsidiary file names must be unique within the export operation.
Some images in the document can be unavailable. To check image availability use the property.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Saving.ImageSavingArgs.IsImageAvailable
member.summary: Returns true if the current image is available for export.

remarks.para: Some images in the document can be unavailable, for example, because the image is linked and the link is inaccessible or does not point to a valid image. In this case Aspose.Words exports an icon with a red cross. This property returns true if the original image is available; returns false if the original image is not available and a "no image" icon will be offered for save.
When saving a group shape or a shape that doesn't require any image this property is always true.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Saving.ImageSavingArgs.ImageFileName
member.summary: Gets or sets the file name (without path) where the image will be saved to.

remarks.para: This property allows you to redefine how the image file names are generated during export to HTML.

When the event is fired, this property contains the file name that was generated by Aspose.Words. You can change the value of this property to save the image into a different file. Note that file names must be unique.
remarks.p: Aspose.Words automatically generates a unique file name for every embedded image when exporting to HTML format. How the image file name is generated depends on whether you save the document to a file or to a stream.
When saving a document to a file, the generated image file name looks like <document base file name>.<image number>.<extension>.
When saving a document to a stream, the generated image file name looks like Aspose.Words.<document guid>.<image number>.<extension>.
remarks.para: must contain only the file name without the path. Aspose.Words determines the path for saving and the value of the src attribute for writing to HTML using the document file name, the and properties.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Saving.ImageSavingArgs.KeepImageStreamOpen
member.summary: Specifies whether Aspose.Words should keep the stream open or close it after saving an image.

remarks.para: Default is false and Aspose.Words will close the stream you provided in the property after writing an image into it. Specify true to keep the stream open.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Saving.ImageSavingArgs.ImageStream
member.summary: Allows to specify the stream where the image will be saved to.

remarks.para: This property allows you to save images to streams instead of files during HTML.
The default value is null. When this property is null, the image will be saved to a file specified in the property.
Using you cannot substitute one image with another. It is intended only for control over location where to save images.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Saving.IImageSavingCallback
member.summary: Implement this interface if you want to control how Aspose.Words saves images when saving a document to HTML. May be used by other formats.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.FileFormatUtil.DetectFileFormat(System.String)
member.overloads: Detects and returns the information about a format of a document.
member.summary: Detects and returns the information about a format of a document stored in a disk file.

remarks.para: Even if this method detects the document format, it does not guarantee that the specified document is valid. This method only detects the document format by reading data that is sufficient for detection. To fully verify that a document is valid you need to load the document into a object.
This method throws when the format is recognized, but the detection cannot complete because of corruption.

member.param: The file name.
member.returns: A object that contains the detected information.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.FileFormatUtil.DetectFileFormat(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Detects and returns the information about a format of a document stored in a stream.

remarks.para: The stream must be positioned at the beginning of the document.
When this method returns, the position in the stream is restored to the original position.

Even if this method detects the document format, it does not guarantee that the specified document is valid. This method only detects the document format by reading data that is sufficient for detection. To fully verify that a document is valid you need to load the document into a object.
This method throws when the format is recognized, but the detection cannot complete because of corruption.

member.param: The stream.
member.returns: A object that contains the detected information.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Settings.MailMergeSettings
member.summary: Specifies all of the mail merge information for a document.

remarks.para: You can use this object to specify a mail merge data source for a document and this information (along with the available data fields) will appear in Microsoft Word when the user opens this document. Or you can use this object to query mail merge settings that the user has specified in Microsoft Word for this document.
You do not normally need to create objects of this class directly because Mail merge settings of a document are always available via the property.
To detect whether this document is a mail merge main document, check the value of the property.

To remove mail merge settings and data source information from a document you can use the method. Aspose.Words will not write mail merge settings to a document if the property is set to or the property is set to .

The best way to learn how to use the properties of this object is to create a document with a desired data source manually in Microsoft Word and then open that document using Aspose.Words and examine the properties of the and objects. This is a good approach to take if you want to learn how to programmatically configure a data source, for example.

Aspose.Words preserves mail merge information when loading, saving and converting documents between different formats, but does not use this information when performing its own mail merge using the object.

member.summary: Not sure about this one. The Microsoft Word Automation Reference suggests that this specifies that the query is executed every time the document is opened in Microsoft Word. But the OOXML specification suggests that this specifies that the query contains a reference to an external query file which contains the actual query. The default value is false.

member.summary: Specifies that the documents produced during a mail merge operation should be emailed as an attachment rather than the body of the actual e-mail. The default value is false.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Settings.WriteProtection
member.summary: Specifies write protection settings for a document.

remarks.para: Write protection specifies whether the author has recommended that the document is to be opened as read-only and/or require a password to modify a document.
Write protection is different from document protection. Write protection is specified in Microsoft Word in the options of the Save As dialog box.
You do not create instances of this class directly. You access document protection settings via the property.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Settings.WriteProtection.SetPassword(System.String)
member.summary: Sets the write protection password for the document.

remarks.para: If a password is set, Microsoft Word will require the user to enter it or open the document as read-only.

member.param: The password to set. Cannot be null, but can be an empty string.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Settings.WriteProtection.ValidatePassword(System.String)
member.summary: Returns true if the specified password is the same as the write-protection password the document was protected with. If document is not write-protected with password then returns false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Settings.WriteProtection.ReadOnlyRecommended
member.summary: Specifies whether the document author has recommended that the document be opened as read-only.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Settings.WriteProtection.IsWriteProtected
member.summary: Returns true when a write protection password is set.

summary.p: The Aspose.Words.Fields namespace contains classes that represent Microsoft Word fields in a document.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Settings.ViewOptions.ZoomPercent
member.summary: Gets or sets the percentage (between 10 and 500) at which you want to view your document.

remarks.p: If value is 0 then this property uses 100 instead, else if value is less than 10 or greater than 500 this property throws.
Although Aspose.Words is able to read and write this option, its usage is application-specific. For example MS Word 2013 does not respect the value of this option.

remarks.p: Use the property to access fill properties of a shape. You do not create instances of the class directly.

Although the class provides properties to specify solid color fill only, all of the more complex fill types, including as gradient, pattern and texture are fully preserved during document open-save cycles.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Drawing.GroupShape
member.summary: Represents a group of shapes in a document.

remarks.p: A is a composite node and can have and nodes as children.
Each defines a new coordinate system for its child shapes. The coordinate system is defined using the and properties.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Drawing.ShapeBase
member.summary: Base class for objects in the drawing layer, such as an AutoShape, freeform, OLE object, ActiveX control, or picture.

remarks.p: This is an abstract class. The two derived classes that you can instantiate are and .
A shape is a node in the document tree.
If the shape is a child of a object, then the shape is said to be "top-level". Top-level shapes are measured and positioned in points.

A shape can also occur as a child of a object when several shapes are grouped. Child shapes of a group shape are positioned in the coordinate space and units defined by the and properties of the parent group shape.
A shape can be positioned inline with text or floating. The positioning method is controlled using the property.
When a shape is floating, it is positioned relative to something (e.g the current paragraph, the margin or the page). The relative positioning of the shape is specified using the and properties.
A floating shape be positioned explicitly using the and properties or aligned relative to some other object using the and properties.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Drawing.ShapeBase.GetShapeRenderer
member.summary: Creates and returns an object that can be used to render this shape into an image.

remarks.para: This method just invokes the constructor and passes this object as a parameter.

member.returns: The renderer object for this shape.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Drawing.ShapeBase.HRef
member.summary: Gets or sets the full hyperlink address for a shape.

remarks.p: The default value is an empty string.
Below are examples of valid values for this property:
Full URI: http://www.aspose.com/.
Full file name: C:\\My Documents\\SalesReport.doc.
remarks.para: Relative URI: ../../../resource.txt
remarks.p: Relative file name: ..\\My Documents\\SalesReport.doc.
Bookmark within another document: http://www.aspose.com/Products/Default.aspx#Suites
Bookmark within this document: #BookmakName.

member.summary: Returns true if the shape type allows the shape to have an image.

remarks.para: Although Microsoft Word has a special shape type for images, it appears that in Microsoft Word documents any shape except a group shape can have an image, therefore this property returns true for all shapes except .

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Drawing.ShapeBase.AnchorLocked
member.summary: Specifies whether the shape's anchor is locked.

remarks.p: The default value is false.
Has effect only for top level shapes.
This property affects behavior of the shape's anchor in Microsoft Word. When the anchor is not locked, moving the shape in Microsoft Word can move the shape's anchor too.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Drawing.ShapeBase.AllowOverlap
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies whether this shape can overlap other shapes.

remarks.para: This property affects behavior of the shape in Microsoft Word. Aspose.Words ignores the value of this property.
This property is applicable only to top level shapes.
remarks.p: The default value is true.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Drawing.ShapeBase.BehindText
member.summary: Specifies whether the shape is below or above text.

remarks.p: Has effect only for top level shapes.
The default value is false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Drawing.ShapeBase.IsInline
member.summary: A quick way to determine if this shape is positioned inline with text.

remarks.p: Has effect only for top level shapes.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Drawing.ShapeBase.Left
member.summary: Gets or sets the position of the left edge of the containing block of the shape.

remarks.p: For a top-level shape, the value is in points and relative to the shape anchor.
For shapes in a group, the value is in the coordinate space and units of the parent group.
The default value is 0.
Has effect only for floating shapes.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Drawing.ShapeBase.Top
member.summary: Gets or sets the position of the top edge of the containing block of the shape.

remarks.p: For a top-level shape, the value is in points and relative to the shape anchor.
For shapes in a group, the value is in the coordinate space and units of the parent group.
The default value is 0.
Has effect only for floating shapes.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Drawing.ShapeBase.Right
member.summary: Gets the position of the right edge of the containing block of the shape.

remarks.p: For a top-level shape, the value is in points and relative to the shape anchor.
For shapes in a group, the value is in the coordinate space and units of the parent group.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Drawing.ShapeBase.Bottom
member.summary: Gets the position of the bottom edge of the containing block of the shape.

remarks.p: For a top-level shape, the value is in points and relative to the shape anchor.
For shapes in a group, the value is in the coordinate space and units of the parent group.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Drawing.ShapeBase.Width
member.summary: Gets or sets the width of the containing block of the shape.

remarks.p: For a top-level shape, the value is in points.
For shapes in a group, the value is in the coordinate space and units of the parent group.
The default value is 0.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Drawing.ShapeBase.Height
member.summary: Gets or sets the height of the containing block of the shape.

remarks.p: For a top-level shape, the value is in points.
For shapes in a group, the value is in the coordinate space and units of the parent group.
The default value is 0.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Drawing.ShapeBase.DistanceTop
member.summary: Returns or sets the distance (in points) between the document text and the top edge of the shape.

remarks.p: The default value is 0.
Has effect only for top level shapes.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Drawing.ShapeBase.DistanceBottom
member.summary: Returns or sets the distance (in points) between the document text and the bottom edge of the shape.

remarks.p: The default value is 0.
Has effect only for top level shapes.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Drawing.ShapeBase.DistanceLeft
member.summary: Returns or sets the distance (in points) between the document text and the left edge of the shape.

remarks.p: The default value is 1/8 inch.
Has effect only for top level shapes.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Drawing.ShapeBase.DistanceRight
member.summary: Returns or sets the distance (in points) between the document text and the right edge of the shape.

remarks.p: The default value is 1/8 inch.
Has effect only for top level shapes.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Drawing.ShapeBase.Rotation
member.summary: Defines the angle (in degrees) that a shape is rotated. Positive value corresponds to clockwise rotation angle.

remarks.p: The default value is 0.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Drawing.ShapeBase.ZOrder
member.summary: Determines the display order of overlapping shapes.

remarks.p: Has effect only for top level shapes.
The default value is 0.
The number represents the stacking precedence. A shape with a higher number will be displayed as if it were overlapping (in "front" of) a shape with a lower number.
The order of overlapping shapes is independent for shapes in the header and in the main text of the document.
The display order of child shapes in a group shape is determined by their order inside the group shape.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Drawing.ShapeBase.ParentParagraph
member.summary: Returns the immediate parent paragraph.
member.remarks: For child shapes of a group shape always returns null.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Drawing.ShapeBase.Bounds
member.summary: Gets or sets the location and size of the containing block of the shape.
member.remarks: Ignores aspect ratio lock upon setting.

remarks.p: For a top-level shape, the value is in points and relative to the shape anchor.
For shapes in a group, the value is in the coordinate space and units of the parent group.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Drawing.ImageData
member.summary: Defines an image for a shape.

remarks.p: Use the property to access and modify the image inside a shape. You do not create instances of the class directly.
An image can be stored inside a shape, linked to external file or both (linked and stored in the document).

Regardless of whether the image is stored inside the shape or linked, you can always access the actual image using the , , or methods. If the image is stored inside the shape, you can also directly access it using the property.
To store an image inside a shape use the method. To link an image to a shape, set the property.

member.summary: Sets the image that the shape displays.

member.param: The stream that contains the image.

member.param: The image file. Can be a file name or a URL.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Drawing.ImageData.ToImage
member.summary: Gets the image stored in the shape as a .NET Image object.

remarks.p: A new object is created every time this method is called.
It is the responsibility of the caller to dispose the image object.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Drawing.ImageData.ToStream
member.summary: Creates and returns a stream that contains the image bytes.

remarks.p: If the image bytes are stored in the shape, creates and returns a object.
If the image is linked and stored in a file, opens the file and returns a object.
If the image is linked and stored in an external URL, downloads the file and returns a object.
Is it the responsibility of the caller to dispose the stream object.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Drawing.ImageData.ToByteArray
member.summary: Returns image bytes for any image regardless whether the image is stored or linked.

remarks.para: If the image is linked, downloads the image every time it is called.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Drawing.ImageData.CropTop
member.summary: Defines the fraction of picture removal from the top side.

remarks.p: The amount of cropping can range from -1.0 to 1.0. The default value is 0. Note that a value of 1 will display no picture at all. Negative values will result in the picture being squeezed inward from the edge being cropped (the empty space between the picture and the cropped edge will be filled by the fill color of the shape). Positive values less than 1 will result in the remaining picture being stretched to fit the shape.
The default value is 0.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Drawing.ImageData.CropBottom
member.summary: Defines the fraction of picture removal from the bottom side.

remarks.p: The amount of cropping can range from -1.0 to 1.0. The default value is 0. Note that a value of 1 will display no picture at all. Negative values will result in the picture being squeezed inward from the edge being cropped (the empty space between the picture and the cropped edge will be filled by the fill color of the shape). Positive values less than 1 will result in the remaining picture being stretched to fit the shape.
The default value is 0.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Drawing.ImageData.CropLeft
member.summary: Defines the fraction of picture removal from the left side.

remarks.p: The amount of cropping can range from -1.0 to 1.0. The default value is 0. Note that a value of 1 will display no picture at all. Negative values will result in the picture being squeezed inward from the edge being cropped (the empty space between the picture and the cropped edge will be filled by the fill color of the shape). Positive values less than 1 will result in the remaining picture being stretched to fit the shape.
The default value is 0.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Drawing.ImageData.CropRight
member.summary: Defines the fraction of picture removal from the right side.

remarks.p: The amount of cropping can range from -1.0 to 1.0. The default value is 0. Note that a value of 1 will display no picture at all. Negative values will result in the picture being squeezed inward from the edge being cropped (the empty space between the picture and the cropped edge will be filled by the fill color of the shape). Positive values less than 1 will result in the remaining picture being stretched to fit the shape.
The default value is 0.

summary.p: The Aspose.Words.Drawing namespace contains classes that allow to create and modify drawing objects in Microsoft Word documents.
Aspose.Words supports all drawing objects in Microsoft Word documents, including OfficeArt shapes, textboxes, pictures, diagrams, OLE objects and ActiveX controls.
The main classes in this namespace are:

list.item: represents an object in the drawing layer, such as an AutoShape, textbox, freeform, OLE object, ActiveX control, or picture.
represents a group of shapes in a document.
is the base class for the shape and group shape classes, provides all common shape properties such as position, size and text wrapping. A shape is a node in the document tree.

summary.p: Although not every type of drawing object can be programmatically created and not every shape property can be accessed, all drawing objects are fully preserved in Microsoft Word documents during document open-save operations.
Names of classes, methods and properties in this namespace correspond to VML DOM where possible.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Drawing.OleFormat
member.summary: Provides access to the data of an OLE object or ActiveX control.

remarks.p: Use the property to access the data of an OLE object. You do not create instances of the class directly.

member.summary: Saves the data of the embedded object into the specified stream.

remarks.p: It is the responsibility of the caller to dispose the stream.

member.exception: Throws if you attempt to save a linked object.

member.summary: Saves the data of the embedded object into a file with the specified name.
member.exception: Throws if you attempt to save a linked object.

Gets icon caption of OLE object.
In case of OLE object is not embedded as icon or caption couldn't be retrieved returns empty string.

member.summary: Gets or sets the ProgID of the OLE object.

remarks.para: The ProgID property is not always present in Microsoft Word documents and cannot be relied upon.
Cannot be null.
remarks.p: The default value is an empty string.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Drawing.OleFormat.IsLink
member.summary: Returns true if the OLE object is linked (when is specified).

member.summary: Gets or sets the path and name of the source file for the linked OLE object.

remarks.p: The default value is an empty string.
If is not an empty string, the OLE object is linked.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Drawing.OleFormat.SourceItem
member.summary: Gets or sets a string that is used to identify the portion of the source file that is being linked.

remarks.p: The default value is an empty string.
For example, if the source file is a Microsoft Excel workbook, the property might return "Workbook1!R3C1:R4C2" if the OLE object contains only a few cells from the worksheet.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Drawing.OleFormat.AutoUpdate
member.summary: Specifies whether the link to the OLE object is automatically updated or not in Microsoft Word.

remarks.p: The default value is false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Drawing.OleFormat.OleIcon
member.summary: Gets the draw aspect of the OLE object. When true, the OLE object is displayed as an icon. When false, the OLE object is displayed as content.

remarks.para: Aspose.Words does not allow to set this property to avoid confusion. If you were able to change the draw aspect in Aspose.Words, Microsoft Word would still display the OLE object in its original draw aspect until you edit or update the OLE object in Microsoft Word.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Drawing.OleFormat.IsLocked
member.summary: Specifies whether the link to the OLE object is locked from updates.

remarks.p: The default value is false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Drawing.OleFormat.Clsid
member.summary: Gets the CLSID of the OLE object.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Drawing.Shape
member.summary: Represents an object in the drawing layer, such as an AutoShape, textbox, freeform, OLE object, ActiveX control, or picture.

remarks.p: Using the class you can create or modify shapes in a Microsoft Word document.

An important property of a shape is its . Shapes of different types can have different capabilities in a Word document. For example, only image and OLE shapes can have images inside them. Most of the shapes can have text, but not all.
Shapes that can have text, can contain and nodes as children.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Drawing.Shape.#ctor(Aspose.Words.DocumentBase)
member.summary: Ctor. Use this internally only.
member.param: The owner document.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Drawing.Shape.#ctor(Aspose.Words.DocumentBase,Aspose.Words.Drawing.ShapeMarkupLanguage)
member.summary: Ctor. Use this internally only. WORDSNET-11493 Implement possibility to create DML shapes by default.
member.param: The owner document.
Shape markup language: DrawingML or Vml

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Drawing.Shape.#ctor(Aspose.Words.DocumentBase,Aspose.Words.Drawing.ShapeType)
member.summary: Creates a new shape object.

remarks.p: You should specify desired shape properties after you created a shape.

member.param: The owner document.
The type of the shape to create.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Drawing.Shape.Accept(Aspose.Words.DocumentVisitor)
member.summary: Accepts a visitor.

remarks.p: Enumerates over this node and all of its children. Each node calls a corresponding method on DocumentVisitor.
For more info see the Visitor design pattern.

member.param: The visitor that will visit the nodes.
member.returns: True if all nodes were visited; false if DocumentVisitor stopped the operation before visiting all nodes.
member.remarks: Calls , then calls for all child nodes of the shape and calls at the end.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Drawing.Shape.Clone(System.Boolean,Aspose.Words.INodeCloningListener)
member.summary: Creates a duplicate of the node.

remarks.p: This method serves as a copy constructor for nodes. The cloned node has no parent, but belongs to the same document as the original node.
This method always performs a deep copy of the node. The isCloneChildren parameter specifies whether to perform copy all child nodes as well.

member.param: True to recursively clone the subtree under the specified node; false to clone only the node itself.
member.returns: The cloned node.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Fonts.FontSettings
member.summary: This class provides static methods that allow to specify the location of TrueType fonts that Aspose.Words will use when rendering documents to PDF, XPS, printing, imaging or embedding fonts into EPUB and other document formats that support embedded fonts.

remarks.para: Aspose.Words loads fonts and caches them in a static cache (e.g. shared between rendering of different documents). While setting the new location for fonts is safe at any time from any thread, it is recommended that you do not change the location of fonts while some documents might be in in the process of rendering. It is recommended that you set the location of fonts during program startup before rendering any documents.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Fonts.FontSettings.SetFontsFolder(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets the folder where Aspose.Words looks for TrueType fonts when rendering documents or embedding fonts. This is a shortcut to for setting only one font directory.
member.param: The folder that contains TrueType fonts.
True to scan the specified folders for fonts recursively.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Fonts.FontSettings.SetFontsFolders(System.String[],System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets the folders where Aspose.Words looks for TrueType fonts when rendering documents or embedding fonts.

remarks.para: By default, Aspose.Words looks for fonts installed to the system.
Setting this property resets the cache of all previously loaded fonts.

member.param: An array of folders that contain TrueType fonts.
True to scan the specified folders for fonts recursively.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Fonts.FontSettings.SetFontsSources(Aspose.Words.Fonts.FontSourceBase[])
member.summary: Sets the sources where Aspose.Words looks for TrueType fonts when rendering documents or embedding fonts.

remarks.para: By default, Aspose.Words looks for fonts installed to the system.
Setting this property resets the cache of all previously loaded fonts.

member.param: An array of sources that contain TrueType fonts.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Fonts.FontSettings.GetFontsSources
member.summary: Gets a copy of the array that contains the list of sources where Aspose.Words looks for TrueType fonts.

remarks.para: The returned value is a copy of the data that Aspose.Words uses. If you change the entries in the returned array, it will have no effect on document rendering. To specify new font sources use the method.

member.returns: A copy of the current font sources.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Fonts.FontSettings.ResetFontSources
member.summary: Resets the fonts sources to the system default.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Fonts.FontSettings.GetFontSubstitutes(System.String)
member.summary: Returns array containing alternative font names to be used if original font is not presented in system.
member.param: Original font name.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Fonts.FontSettings.SetFontSubstitutes(System.String,System.String[])
member.summary: Override substitute (alternative) font names for given original font name.
member.param: Original font name.
List of alternative font names to be used if original font is not presented in system.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Fonts.FontSettings.AddFontSubstitutes(System.String,System.String[])
member.summary: Adds substitute (alternative) font names for given original font name.
member.param: Original font name.
List of alternative font names to be used if original font is not presented in system.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Fonts.FontSettings.DefaultFontName
member.summary: Gets or sets the default font name.

remarks.para: The default font name is used when Aspose.Words can't find requested font in specified sources.
The default value is 'Times New Roman'.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Rendering.ShapeRenderer
member.summary: Provides methods to render an individual or to a raster or vector image or to a Graphics object.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Rendering.ShapeRenderer.#ctor(Aspose.Words.Drawing.ShapeBase)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of this class.
member.param: The DrawinML shape object that you want to render.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Rendering.ShapeRenderer.GetSizeInPixels(System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Calculates the size of the shape in pixels for a specified zoom factor and resolution.

remarks.para: This method converts into size in pixels and it is useful when you want to create a bitmap for rendering the shape neatly onto the bitmap.

member.param: The zoom factor (1.0 is 100%).
The resolution to convert from points to pixels (dots per inch).
member.returns: The size of the shape in pixels.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Rendering.ShapeRenderer.GetOpaqueRectangleInPixels(System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Calculates the opaque rectangle of the shape in pixels for a specified zoom factor and resolution.

remarks.para: This method converts into rectangle in pixels and it is useful when you want to create a bitmap for rendering the shape with only opaque part of the shape.

member.param: The zoom factor (1.0 is 100%).
The resolution to convert from points to pixels (dots per inch).
member.returns: The opaque rectangle of the shape in pixels.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Rendering.ShapeRenderer.RenderToScale(System.Drawing.Graphics,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Renders the shape into a object to a specified scale.
member.param: The object where to render to.
The X coordinate (in world units) of the top left corner of the rendered shape.
The Y coordinate (in world units) of the top left corner of the rendered shape.
The scale for rendering the shape (1.0 is 100%).
member.returns: The width and height (in world units) of the rendered shape.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Rendering.ShapeRenderer.RenderToSize(System.Drawing.Graphics,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Renders the shape into a object to a specified size.
member.param: The object where to render to.
The X coordinate (in world units) of the top left corner of the rendered shape.
The Y coordinate (in world units) of the top left corner of the rendered shape.
The maximum width (in world units) that can be occupied by the rendered shape.
The maximum height (in world units) that can be occupied by the rendered shape.
member.returns: The scale that was automatically calculated for the rendered shape to fit the specified size.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Rendering.ShapeRenderer.Save(System.String,Aspose.Words.Saving.ImageSaveOptions)
member.overloads: Renders the shape and saves into an image.
member.summary: Renders the shape into an image and saves into a file.
member.param: The name for the image file. If a file with the specified name already exists, the existing file is overwritten.
Specifies the options that control how the shape is rendered and saved. Can be null.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Rendering.ShapeRenderer.Save(System.IO.Stream,Aspose.Words.Saving.ImageSaveOptions)
member.summary: Renders the shape into an image and saves into a stream.
member.param: The stream where to save the image of the shape.
Specifies the options that control how the shape is rendered and saved. Can be null. If this is null, the image will be saved in the PNG format.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Rendering.ShapeRenderer.SizeInPoints
member.summary: Gets the actual size of the shape in points.

remarks.para: This property returns the size of the actual (as rendered on the page) bounding box of the shape. The size takes into account shape rotation (if any).

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Rendering.ShapeRenderer.OpaqueBoundsInPoints
member.summary: Gets the opaque bounds of the shape in points.

remarks.para: This property returns the opaque (i.e. transparent parts of the shape are ignored) bounding box of the shape. The bounds takes the shape rotation into account.

member.summary: The shape is an image.

member.summary: The shape is a textbox. Note that shapes of many other types can also have text inside them too. A shape does not have to have this type to contain text.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Drawing.ShapeType.Group

summary.p: The shape is a group shape.

member.dev: In DOC file, shape group has shape type NonPrimitive, we don't want this in the model, so in the model it is our own constant.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Drawing.ShapeType.OleObject
member.summary:
The shape is an OLE object.
You cannot create shapes of this type in the document.
member.dev: In Microsoft Word, shapes that represent OLE objects have shape type picture, but in our model, they are distinguished into their own shape type.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Drawing.ShapeType.OleControl
member.summary:
The shape is an ActiveX control.
You cannot create shapes of this type in the document.
member.dev: In DOC and RTF, shapes that represent ActiveX controls have shape type picture. In WordML, ActiveX controls have their own shape type and so is in the model.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Drawing.ShapeType.NonPrimitive
member.summary:
A shape drawn by user and consisting of multiple segments and/or vertices (curve, freeform or scribble).
You cannot create shapes of this type in the document.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Drawing.ShapeType.CustomShape
member.summary:
This shape type seems to be set for shapes that are not part of the standard set of the auto shapes in Microsoft Word. For example, if you insert a new auto shape from ClipArt.
You cannot create shapes of this type in the document.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Drawing.TextPath
member.summary: Defines the text and formatting of the text path (of a WordArt object).

remarks.p: Use the property to access WordArt properties of a shape. You do not create instances of the class directly.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Drawing.TextPath.On
member.summary: Defines whether the text is displayed.

remarks.p: The default value is false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Drawing.TextPath.FitPath
member.summary: Defines whether the text fits the path of a shape.

remarks.p: The default value is false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Drawing.TextPath.FitShape
member.summary: Defines whether the text fits bounding box of a shape.

remarks.p: The default value is false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Drawing.TextPath.FontFamily
member.summary: Defines the family of the textpath font.

remarks.p: The default value is Arial.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Drawing.TextPath.Size
member.summary: Defines the size of the font in points.

remarks.p: The default value is 36.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Drawing.TextPath.Bold
member.summary: True if the font is formatted as bold.

remarks.p: The default value is false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Drawing.TextPath.Italic
member.summary: True if the font is formatted as italic.

remarks.p: The default value is false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Drawing.TextPath.SmallCaps
member.summary: True if the font is formatted as small capital letters.

remarks.p: The default value is false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Drawing.TextPath.RotateLetters
member.summary: Determines whether the letters of the text are rotated.

remarks.p: The default value is false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Drawing.TextPath.Trim
member.summary: Determines whether extra space is removed above and below the text.

remarks.p: The default value is false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Drawing.TextPath.Kerning
member.summary: Determines whether kerning is turned on.

remarks.p: The default value is false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Drawing.TextPath.Shadow
member.summary: Defines whether a shadow is applied to the text on a text path.

remarks.p: The default value is false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Drawing.TextPath.Underline
member.summary: True if the font is underlined.

remarks.p: The default value is false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Drawing.TextPath.StrikeThrough
member.summary: True if the font is formatted as strikethrough text.

remarks.p: The default value is false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Drawing.TextPath.SameLetterHeights
member.summary: Determines whether all letters will be the same height regardless of initial case.

remarks.p: The default value is false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Drawing.TextPath.Text
member.summary: Defines the text of the text path.

remarks.p: The default value is an empty string.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Drawing.TextPath.TextPathAlignment
member.summary: Defines the alignment of text.

remarks.p: The default value is .

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Drawing.TextPath.ReverseRows
member.summary: Determines whether the layout order of rows is reversed.

remarks.p: The default value is false.
If true, the layout order of rows is reversed. This attribute is used for vertical text layout.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Drawing.TextPath.Spacing
member.summary: Defines the amount of spacing for text. 1 means 100%.

remarks.p: The default value is 1.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Drawing.TextPath.XScale
member.summary: Determines whether a straight textpath will be used instead of the shape path.

remarks.p: The default value is false.
If true, the text runs along a path from left to right along the x value of the lower boundary of the shape.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Drawing.VerticalAlignment
member.summary: Specifies vertical alignment of a floating shape, text frame or a floating table.
member.dev: Do not renumber. The values are taken from the RTF specification.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Drawing.VerticalAlignment.None
member.summary: The object is explicitly positioned, usually using its Top property.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Drawing.VerticalAlignment.Top
member.summary: Specifies that the object shall be at the top of the vertical alignment base.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Drawing.VerticalAlignment.Center
member.summary: Specifies that the object shall be centered with respect to the vertical alignment base.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Drawing.VerticalAlignment.Bottom
member.summary: Specifies that the object shall be at the bottom of the vertical alignment base.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Drawing.VerticalAlignment.Inside
member.summary: Specifies that the object shall be inside of the horizontal alignment base.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Drawing.VerticalAlignment.Outside
member.summary: Specifies that the object shall be outside of the vertical alignment base.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Drawing.VerticalAlignment.Default
member.summary: Same as .

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Drawing.WrapSide
member.summary: Specifies what side(s) of the shape or picture the text wraps around.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Drawing.WrapSide.Both
member.summary: The document text wraps on both sides of the shape.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Drawing.WrapSide.Left
member.summary: The document text wraps on the left side of the shape only. There is a text free area on the right of the shape.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Drawing.WrapSide.Right
member.summary: The document text wraps on the right side of the shape only. There is a text free area on the left side of the shape.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Drawing.WrapSide.Largest
member.summary: The document text wraps on the side of the shape that is farthest from the page margin, leaving text free area on the other side of the shape.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Drawing.WrapSide.Default
member.summary: Default value is .

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Drawing.WrapType
member.summary: Specifies how text is wrapped around a shape or picture.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Drawing.WrapType.None
member.summary: No text wrapping around the shape. The shape is placed behind or in front of text.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Drawing.WrapType.Inline
member.summary: The shape remains on the same layer as text and treated as a character.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Drawing.WrapType.TopBottom
member.summary: The text stops at the top of the shape and restarts on the line below the shape.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Drawing.WrapType.Square
member.summary: Wraps text around all sides of the square bounding box of the shape.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Drawing.WrapType.Tight
member.summary: Wraps tightly around the edges of the shape, instead of wrapping around the bounding box.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Drawing.WrapType.Through
member.summary: Same as Tight, but wraps inside any parts of the shape that are open.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Footnote
member.summary: Represents a container for text of a footnote or endnote.

remarks.p: The Footnote class is used to represent both footnotes and endnotes in a Word document.
Footnote is an inline-level node and can only be a child of Paragraph.
Footnote can contain Paragraph and Table child nodes.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.InlineStory
member.summary: Base class for inline-level nodes that can contain paragraphs and tables.

remarks.p: InlineStory is a container for block-level nodes and .

The classes that derive from InlineStory are inline-level nodes that can contain their own text (paragraphs and tables). For example, a Comment node contains text of a comment and a Footnote contains text of a footnote.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.InlineStory.EnsureMinimum
member.summary: If the last child is not a paragraph, creates and appends one empty paragraph.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.InlineStory.StoryType
member.summary: Returns the type of the story.

member.summary: Retrieves the parent of this node.

member.summary: Gets the first paragraph in the story.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.InlineStory.LastParagraph
member.summary: Gets the last paragraph in the story.

member.summary: Gets a collection of paragraphs that are immediate children of the story.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.InlineStory.Tables
member.summary: Gets a collection of tables that are immediate children of the story.

member.summary: Returns true if this object was inserted in Microsoft Word while change tracking was enabled.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Footnote.#ctor(Aspose.Words.DocumentBase,Aspose.Words.FootnoteType)
member.summary: Initializes an instance of the Footnote class.

remarks.p: When Footnote is created, it belongs to the specified document, but is not yet part of the document and ParentNode is null.
To append Footnote to the document use InsertAfter or InsertBefore on the paragraph where you want the footnote inserted.

member.param: The owner document.
A value that specifies whether this is a footnote or endnote.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Footnote.Accept(Aspose.Words.DocumentVisitor)
member.summary: Accepts a visitor.

remarks.p: Enumerates over this node and all of its children. Each node calls a corresponding method on DocumentVisitor.
For more info see the Visitor design pattern.

member.param: The visitor that will visit the nodes.
member.returns: True if all nodes were visited; false if DocumentVisitor stopped the operation before visiting all nodes.
member.remarks: Calls DocumentVisitor.VisitFootnoteStart, then calls Accept for all child nodes of the footnote and calls DocumentVisitor.VisitFootnoteEnd at the end.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Footnote.NodeType
member.summary: Returns NodeType.Footnote.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Footnote.StoryType
member.summary: Returns StoryType.Footnotes or StoryType.Endnotes.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Footnote.FootnoteType
member.summary: Returns a value that specifies whether this is a footnote or endnote.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Footnote.IsAuto
member.summary: Holds a value that specifies whether this is a auto-numbered footnote or footnote with user defined custom reference mark.
member.remarks: initialized with empty string if IsAuto set to false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Footnote.ReferenceMark
member.summary: Gets/sets custom reference mark to be used for this footnote. Default value is , meaning auto-numbered footnotes are used.

remarks.para: If this property is set to or null, then property will automatically be set to true, if set to anything else then will be set to false.
RTF-format can only store 1 symbol as custom reference mark, so upon export only the first symbol will be written others will be discard.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.FootnoteType
member.summary: Specifies whether this is a footnote or an endnote.

remarks.para: Both footnotes and endnotes are represented by objects by the class. Use to distinguish between footnotes and endnotes.

member.summary: The object is a footnote.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.FootnoteType.Endnote
member.summary: The object is an endnote.
